Reviews.Title: “Loved the location!”
Reviews.Author: luvmy3kids
Reviews.Content: This was a 5 minute walk off the San Marco/San Zacchari water taxi stop. The location was absolutely perfect. The rooms are very small but very modern and clean. We booked the twin room and were pleasantly surprised that we were upgrade to the double w/a balcony. There is no elevator so if steps is a problem make sure to stay lower. Our room was on the 3rd floor. Not a horrible climb, but having knee problems it was a bit painful by the end of the night. The breakfast in the morning was the best out of Rome & Florence. We had a nice omelet, fresh fruit, pastries, yogurt & juice. They also had a very good dinnner! Another plus was that we were 5 minutes from the airport water taxi service. The hotel told us about it and it only ran us $15 euro/pp for a ride straight to the airport. It took about 1 hour 10 minutes, but was so worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay . Will return.”
Reviews.Author: Barfoot
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and faultless service with a smile. Kind and considerate staff. Room was small but you don't go to Venice for the hotel room so we were more than satisfied. Pricey but that's Venice for you and didn't think it overpriced.. Breakfast plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Telegramsam88
Reviews.Content: This is right beside the basilica in a great location. Staff were very hospitable, in fact when we arrived our luggage was not on the plane . We were staying one night there and catching a cruise ship the following day. The owner spent the day and overnight to track down where our luggage was. He found it and indicated he knew the owner of the company that gets lost luggage and ensured it got to the ship the next day. We don't speak Italian and I am certain without his help we would not have had such a positive outcome. He and his staff did not have to do ths but demonstrates their commitment to their gusts. The room we were in was very romantic, clean and had an amazing shower. The breakfast in the morning was awesome and it was quiet. I wold recommend this hotel for the courtesy of staff, quality of food and cleanliness of hotel. Again location was great for sightseeing. It was a very nice memory to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: GastroG
Reviews.Content: My pre-conceived idea was that this hotel would be acceptable, yet purely reliant on its location. How wrong that turned out! This is an incredible little gem. We were lucky enough to have the top floor room and although small, was excellently finished and unbelievably charming. The seating area with the bay windows was brilliant and the adjoining balcony and terrace was an incredible place to relax. Although situated about 100m from Saint Mark's square, we felt miles away from the hustle and bustle of the more touristy side if Venice. Breakfast was also brilliant (and included). Nice continental breads and fruit as well as a cooked omelette. Throughout our booking process and stay, Susanna was always incredibly helpful and friendly and showed a genuine welcome for her guests. I will never stay anywhere else in Venice and cannot recommend this hotel highly enough - worth every penny!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, nice people”
Reviews.Author: brunogouveia
Reviews.Content: we stayed only for two nights but at the moment we came into the hotel, the hospitality and friendship of everyone was amazing. If you take the boat from the airport, you leave at San Zaccaria that's just one stop before San Marco's Square. Great location, good price, and nice restaurant. Ã“timo lugar para ficar! Adoramos a dica daqui! Pessoal super simpÃ¡tico.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Brittany W
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellent! The were very attentive and answered all my questions. The hotel itself was just beautifull! It was very clean and both rooms had there own private balcony. The bathrooms were also clean and the shower was a great size. Breakfast was great, we could not believe that it was all included because we recieved so much food. The location was great, although I would suggest to google the location first because it is in a little alleyway that may be difficult to find. The price of the hotel is a little high but I was willing to spend the extra for the comfort of the rooms and service of the staff. Also, they have tickets available for different tours and shows in the city. We saw a show on the story of Venice which was very nice and fun to learn about they're culture and how it began. We will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: jcruck
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a wonderful location. Rooms are spacious and spotless. Breakfast was excellent and the staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Location”
Reviews.Author: T M
Reviews.Content: The best thing this hotel has going for it is LOCATION. Steps from St. Marks's, we could see the Bridge of Sighs from our top floor room, yet right off the beaten track, 100m from the water taxi dock, yet you would never know it was there, unless you knew it was there. Location and quiet ambiance, the perfect combination. Will stay there again, and again, and again.

Reviews.Title: “Venice at its best!”
Reviews.Author: ToughLoveTravel
Reviews.Content: The charm of our surroundings and accommodations was outdone only by the graciousness of our hosts, Stephano and company. Ideal location, only steps from vaporetta (water taxi) and St Marco Square which gave us great flexibility... we stepped out our door and the magic of Venice unfolded before us! Beautiful outdoor terraces up in rooftops of Venice, best breakfast of trip! We will return.

Reviews.Title: “great place in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Tubbybren
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally situated in the heart of Venice (at the back of the Palazzo Ducale). it's clean fresh, welcoming and has all that you would wish for a short stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “a tiny gem”
Reviews.Author: Frances R
Reviews.Content: There's lots to like about the Ca' dei Dogi. It's in a great spot, just a couple of minutes from San Marco and close to the vaporetto stop and lots of good restaurants. The staff are lovely and very helpful. They go out of their way for you. The room was lovely in many ways- beautifully decorated, very clean, quiet- but it was also very tiny and I'm quite claustrophobic. This is the only negative I have for this place.

Reviews.Title: “Smalll, intimate, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: CristiLeon
Reviews.Content: Charming 15th century building, right on the waterfront and to water bus station. Small building, historic details, comfortable room. The hotel is very close to San Marco square, yet away from the noise and the crowd. Right outside there are fine restaurants and small shops/grocery. Wifi worked good. We were lucky to book a one-night last minute offer, but the regular price is high. Helpful staff. We really enjoyed staying there, and we'll be happy to come back :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great little apartment!”
Reviews.Author: ZurichPizazz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sole apartment across the street from the dining room and it was lovely. True, there is no elevator and I counted 78 steps (6 floors) to get there but it was no so bad. Even our 2 children aged 10 and 13 did not complain about it. But don't worry, your luggage will be brought up by the hotel staff. Don't be put off by the condition of the stairwell or some of the "wet" odours at the front door. It is not representative of what awaits you at the top. Once up there, you will be delighted by a newly decorated and spacious apartment with a lovely balcony overlooking the Palazzo Ducale! Our children slept on the pullout couch in the living room and found it comfortable. The master bedroom was also comfortable. The bathroom has a nice rain shower head which we found very relaxing. Should you want to prepare a small meal, you will find a kitchenette as well as the basic utensils but no spices, oils, or such cooking accessories. The breakfast served in the restaurant had something for everyone (croissants, jams, hot beverages, juice, fruit salad, omelette of your choice, etc) and we were pleased with it. The only suggestion for improvement that we would have is that the bed covers for the pullout couch had a bad smell to them. They were clean but it just seemed like it was dried in a humid place if you know what I mean... Which I guess might be a frequent thing in a place like Venice. So we used the extra covers that were in the master bedroom closet and set the smelly ones aside.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Naomi L
Reviews.Content: A nice, clean hotel only 5 minutes walk from San Marco, and for me, a room overlooking the Doges' jail cells. Friendly staff and good service. Breakfast was really good (especially for the price), with a fresh omelette each morning. One of those hotels where you just feel so pleased you happened to pick that one (on TripAdvisor of course!) Be aware the single room is very tiny. Defintiely no room to swing even a small cat. But it's clean, and beautifully appointed. I didn't have any issues with it, but it's worth being aware of if that's important to you.

Reviews.Title: “NON-SMOKING, ++LOCATION, GREAT BREAKFAST”
Reviews.Author: AndiamoBrian
Reviews.Content: Four of us, two couples, stayed here Oct. 2011. From the airport we took Alilaguna Blue Line public water taxi to the San Zaccaria stop. (One stop before San Marcos stop). The cost was E15 euros per person. The ride was very pleasant and took about 45 - 50 minutes. When you exit the water taxi turn left (towards St. Marks square) go over one bridge (ponte). Prior to reaching the Bridge of Sighs the narrow street/alley Calle degli Albanesi is on your right. Half a block down Albanesi, left at the first corner and there is the hotel. Easy to find! The rooms were very clean, although typically small. Location is within easy walking distance of everything - we walked a lot. The staff is very friendly and accomodating and the breakfast, including a hot omelette each morning, was really good. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Venice - Amazing Location!”
Reviews.Author: rhtrips333
Reviews.Content: Ca' De Dogi was such a great find in Venice. Just a few steps from St. Marks and always quiet at night. My Wife and I stayed from October 9-11, 2011 in the Double Economy Room. The room was really well decorated and very clean. Even though it is not a big room, it never felt too small, not sure about the other rooms in the hotel. All the help was great at the hotel. Suzane helped us check in for our flight home, ordered a water taxi and where to get a good gondola ride. Take advantage of the 10% off dinner or lunch at taverna de dogi. Great breakfast too. We had some bad luck with other Venice restaurants, but this one was good. However, it was not always open when they said it would be. There are alot of stairs in the hotel but they carry the luggage up for you. From the San Zaccaria water bus stop, it is very close, albeit a little bit confusing to find. I would avoid staying in the ground floor room, it is right by the front desk. Overall, we loved the hotel and would definitely return! All the good reviews are justified, I was so glad to find in via trip Advisor!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Yen T
Reviews.Content: We were given a double room for the first night and the apartment at 6 th floor for 2nd and 3rd day. it was perfect and we definitely fell in love with the apartment. The apartment was nicely decorated with a beautiful little balcony and it was very clean. But what really made this place was the staff. We were greeted every morning by Susanna and she was very helpful. Even though there's no lift in the building and we need to climb up and down to/from 6th floor at least twice everyday, nevertheless we never felt tired every time we opened the door to the apartment. One more thing, great location too!!!! We really enjoyed our stay with Ca Dei Dogi in Venice and we made a promise to each other that we will be back again for our 10th anniversary :)

Reviews.Title: “Good if you don't mind stairs!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel1954
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 nights at the Ca' dei Dogi and mostly enjoyed it. The staff are lovely - very friendly and helpful. The hotel is wonderfully positioned - a few yards from the quayside and about 5 minutes walk from St Marks Square but hidden away in a little square - the roof terrace has a view onto the back of the Doge's Palace. The room was quite small but well equipped, with tea and coffee making facilities as well as all the usual amenities. The bathroom was beautiful, large with a great walk-in shower, lovely marble tiles, and very clean and well-maintained. The breakfast was good if a little eccentric - you are served with a selection of everything rather than picking things yourself - but everything is provided including omelettes, fresh fruit, yogurt, and pastries. Only downsides are that it is expensive for the size of room, although comparable with other hotels nearby. Also, we were on the top (third) floor and the stairs are really steep - I am only 5ft tall and it was a real climb! If you don't like stairs, ask for a room lower down when you book!!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: litchsmith
Reviews.Content: Hidden away but in a very central location with very helpful owners/staff. Would recommend the apartment with its own terrace and Palace views if you can manage the 80 or so steps! The owners let us use room 101 to change in before our evening flight - yes it is small and to be avoided - and the owners do know it so only use in emergencies.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: auzigirl03
Reviews.Content: We got a little lost when we first arrived in Venice (which is easy to do) but once we arrived at Ca' dei Dogi - it was perfect! The room was very nice (a little smaller then I expected) with a beautiful little balcony and it was very clean. But what really made this place was the staff. We were greeted every morning by Susana and anytime we had a question, she was able to help us. Breakfast was amazing and it was wonderful to be able to sit outside and enjoy our meal. And as everyone else has pointed out, the location really is perfect. We were close to everything we wanted to see and close to some great restaurants!

Reviews.Title: “"Small on space, big on friendliness!"”
Reviews.Author: kitkat1973
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in May in the twin room - 101 - on the ground floor. I do not recommend this room unless you are thin! It is the tiniest hotel room I've ever seen! There wasn't enough room to have both our suitcases open at the same time,taking a shower posed a bit of a challenge and the only windows were up near the ceiling. The bonus is it's the only room that has wifi in it (otherwise you can use the computer/wifi in the lobby). Thank heavens the delightful Stefano and Susanna more than made up for the tiny room with their exceptional friendliness and help. They were fantastic! The suggestions they gave us really helped make our visit to Venice special. The sensational location of the building also helped - it's just a short walk to St Mark's Square. Breakfast was a delicious affair every morning with omeletes made for us as well as fruit, yoghurt, croissants and capuccinos. We weren't offered omelettes anywhere else in the 5 weeks we were in Italy so that was a pleasant surprise! Overall we enjoyed our stay but would try to book a different room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: travbud1
Reviews.Content: I want to first point out that I am giving the hotel (really a B&B) the overall benefit of the doubt. If there were a 4.5 rating I would be selecting that. Our stay was very pleasent. There are 6 rooms and the owners are very friendly and helpful. As everyone points out, the room is small, but you are in Venice and literally a stones throw from the Bridge of Sighs, so what do you expect? The most important thing is that it is exceedingly clean and quiet. The breakfast is lovely and prepared fresh and served out on the terrace. They offer a 10% discount on their adjoining restaurant (which was ok). Getting in and out of Venice can be a pain, but the location of the hotel to the San Zaccaria stop is excellent and makes travel significantly easier. From our balcony (Batik room) you can see into the Doge's palace so the location is unbeatable. There is also a free laptop in the reception area. There is some creaking from the floors above (so I would recommend the top floor), but overall I would certainly recommend staying here. Book early as there are only 6 rooms and try to avoid the room on the main floor unless you are really on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: CharVacation
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights (August 30 & 31) before our 12 day cruise. We chose the hotel because of other reviews and were not disappointed. Stanafo and his staff were very helpful. We had the twin room on the main floor and we were happy with it. Yes, it was tiny, but it was what we expected from a 15th century hotel. We packed all items for the 2 days in once suitcase and didn't even open the other one. We did not hear running water or people going up the stairs like the other reviewer mentioned. The A/C was a must! From the Dogeâ€™s Palace we could see the roof top terrace. We loved the breakfasts - the omelettes were amazing as were the apple filled croissants. We were asked if we wanted 2 cappuccinos or lattes. We would stay here when we next visit Venice. Venice is an amazing place to visit! The Doge's Palace is worth the price of admission but would suggest buying your ticket a day in advance to avoid the line ups.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: toota101
Reviews.Content: Really nice owners and staff, and always willing to answer questions. Although the 'Batik Room' was extremly small the location of where this hotel is located is great. Its really convenient to walk out of your hotel at 7am and walk into St Marks Square with hardly anyone there. We left early on our last day and the staff organised a nice enough breakfast for us before we left.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this gem of a hotel and Venice.”
Reviews.Author: RichmondLass5
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two nights and really loved it. The position is fantastic - right in the heart of the city but amazingly quiet and peaceful. It really felt hidden away, but only a minute's walk from the waterfront down an alley. (In fact, Venice is full of intriguing alleyways and passages. I found the whole city astonishing.) It's a boutique hotel with great attention to detail inside the rooms. It used to be part of a 15th century palace and has beamed ceilings and lots of nice little touches. What was really nice was the fact it wasn't chintzy, but very tastefully done, unlike some of the larger hotels in Venice. The rooms are definitely small, but this IS an old building and it is quite charming. We stayed on the first floor and it was quiet and peaceful. The breakfast omlettes were absolutely delicious! Another really useful thing was that Susannah very kindly let us leave our suitcase at the hotel, even though we checked out at 11 am and our flight wasn't till 9.30 pm. I couldn't imagine having to drag the case around Venice all day, as it was very crowded - and hot - due to a celebration. We will definitely return to Ca' dei Dogi and to Venice..

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Shari916
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three nights as part of our two week honeymoon in Italy. We feel that the other reviews of the hotel are a bit misleading. We chose it because of its rave reviews, but we were not all that impressed. I will say that the owners were very sweet, helpful, and accomodating. We loved having a jacuzzi in our room and the cute balcony to sit out on and drink wine. However, sleeping in this hotel is not easy for anyone who is not a heavy sleeper. You hear every single noise, from water running through the pipes to people walking around upstairs. We have stayed in other B&Bs and small hotels and never heard any of those noises. We didn't particularly like Venice so one day we decided to hang out the room and enjoy its amenities. Although we had the do not disturb sign on the door, the housekeeper continuously knocked even though we had said, "No thank you!" several times. She finally went away, only to return 20 minutes later, to put her key in the door to open it to clean the room, when we had to scream, "Do NOT come in!". It was really obnoxious!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, everything you need”
Reviews.Author: Varunnayyar
Reviews.Content: Venice was our fisrt stop in Italy.. This hotel was really close to the water bus... And we realised its close to everything.. All sights are 5-10 mins walk from hotel though you might get lost in Venice anyway as its so confusing... The breakfast was fabulous.. just amazing.... we got an ommelette everyday... and amazing croissants... The rooms are really small but very functional with all amenities... you cant expect the room size to be bigger... great decor, really clean.. And Sussana was brilliant with all her help during the stay... Thanks Suasana..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: mckinma
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Ca' dei Dogi while in Venice for a few days. Let me just say first.... BEST LOCATION. The hotel is on a quiet alley just steps from Piazza San Marco, Doge's Palace and the Bridge of Sighs and is very accessible via the gondolas, water taxi stops, etc. Even though it is close to the action, it remains a very quiet and peaceful destination to get away from the tourist madness. In addition, it is a small hotel so the staff get to know you quickly and take fantastic care of you. I highly recommend staying at Ca' dei Dogi if your travels every take you to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay and amazing people”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidTraveller84
Reviews.Content: I stayed in peak season here. I found the owners to be extremely helpful and kind, always answering my questions as if I was an old friend rather Than a guest. Even when I dined alone in the adjoining resturant the staff treated me kindly, even offering me a glass of free wine. The location of the hotel is perfect, literally steps to the grand canal and the main square. The vaporetto step is also steps away and makes the use of water taxis unnecessary as the major routes (no 1 and 2 vaporetto) drop you only steps away. Could not have asked for a better stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly looked after...”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadagain201011
Reviews.Content: Was there for three nights. Excellent customer service. Done by a loving heart. I became ill on the last day just hours before my flight. Suzanne took care of me, slept in the empty room for free during the afternoon. She made me tea. My room on the third floor was very clean although very small. But the size i something I expect in Europe. Location is also very good. Do not think about it...Just come and stay here. They will take care of you. A side note: Went to Danieli for a breakfast. That place NEEDS some major Management transformation regarding the customer service and renovation. It is JUST TOTALLY AWFUL.

Reviews.Title: “Very centrally located hotel.”
Reviews.Author: claregals29
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights on out honeymoon. The hotel is very clean, modern and centrally located. The only downside was that the room was a bit on the small side although it was worth comprimising on this for its close proximity to all the main attractions. We would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfect!”
Reviews.Author: leeleej
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in the ground floor room next to reception. My first reaction was that it was so small I couldn't believe it but after staying for three nights and just sleeping there it was fine. Anyway, all the positives about this B&B far outweigh the negative of a small room. As mentioned by other reviewers it is the ideal spot. We often saw people wheeling suitcases long distances along small streets and thought how lucky we were to be so close to the San Zaccaria stop. We did make use of the terrace and it was wonderful for a late afternoon glass of wine to stop and smell the roses before getting ready for dinner. The room had everything we needed and was lovely and clean. Again, I would have liked enough room to not live out of my suitcase but again it's a small negative. The breakfast was lovely, the position perfect and I can't say enough about the help given by Susannah. Her English is wonderful (sadly we all expect this when we shouldn't) and she was the most helpful person you would ever meet. We needed to send a package home to Australia and Susannah organised all of this for us. This is the sort of service that makes a place worth revisiting. Despite the size of the room we will definitely be staying again. We loved Venice but even better we loved Ca' dei Dogi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Nice Accomodation, Wonderful Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: TripnFool
Reviews.Content: I won't reiterate what others have already said about outstanding location, great staff, very nice breakfast etc. It is all that and more. The Ca dei Dogi is great for some, but maybe not for all. My wife and I loved the property and our stay. As mentioned, rooms can be small and ours was no exception. Don't get me wrong, it did not bother us, but could see how it might be an issue to others. My wife and I are definitely not on the big side (me 5' 9" 170lbs and wife 5' 3" 120lbs) and the room was still very cozy. We were packed for a 3 week trip in Italy, but we still only packed a small suitcase each. Fortunately, we were able to squeeze our suitcases under the bed so we could avoid walking on or around them. We did enjoy the balcony each day to sit outside and read when not out and about. The other downside to our room was the bathroom, again small. The shower the size of a phone booth and your knees would be against the opposite wall when sitting on the throne. These issues really did not bother my wife and I, but I think it can be very useful for someone who is a larger sized person. We have a friend who is quite large (6' 5" 300lbs) and we kept thinking he could not fit in the shower or the bathroom comfortably. These issues aside, we loved our stay, but know that this information could be helpful to other travelers who need more space. We also understand that many European rooms are similarly as small. I hope this is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Location couldnÂ´t be better!”
Reviews.Author: viajantes-rio
Reviews.Content: This is truely a hidden gem of Venice. We had a room with a little balcony where we could listen to the gondoleers singing along the channel. People are very friendly and as its a small hotel it was indeed a very personal treatment. From the hotel you can walk easily to most places, the breakfast was nice. But we had to book well in advance as they are always busy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tymsink
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, another great TripAdvisor find. Rooms in Venice tend to be small, but our room was plenty spacious for 3 people, including a teenager. We had the Superior room which included a separate space with a bed to give everyone a little more privacy. The room was very clean, nice, comfortable, quiet and had a large, modern bathroom. The staff was outstanding, helping us with reservations, recommendations and schedules. They recommended the restaurant that provided one of our best meals in Italy, La Bitta. It was also in a great location, near St Marks and the most popular vaporetto stops. Amenities included full breakfast, A/C, safe.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in the busiest part of Venice”
Reviews.Author: l0ves_t0_plan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clearly run by two proprietors that really care about their business. The location and quality of the rooms were outstanding considering the price. Our room, while small, had the nicest bathroom of our whole trip. The breakfast was probably my least favorite of our vacation but considering they're only serving six rooms that is understandable. The owners even made sure that we knew what water bus to take back to the train station and made sure our breakfast was set out early so we could eat before catching our train.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 2011Doc
Reviews.Content: Our room was small but comfortable, staff were friendly and helpful, breakfast was well above average, and the location was terrific: close to San Marco Piazza, but tucked up a laneway in a quiet world of its own so you could make a quick escape from the hordes. Not cheap, but reasonable by Venice standards. The only negative was something probably beyond the control of management: a selfish couple in a nearby room who thought it was reasonable to shout, laugh, slam doors and generally behave obnoxiously until 4am on consecutive nights.

Reviews.Title: “This place isn't Dodgey, it's a wonderful hidden jewel!”
Reviews.Author: mommawanderlust
Reviews.Content: We are still dreaming about our trip to Switzerland and Italy in the winter. It is in large part due to our stay in Venice. Ca' dei Dogi was a perfect find and quite reasonably priced. We drove through Europe and parked in a parking lot outside of Venice. Cars are not allowed. The train would have taken us to the same location, and then you take a water bus to your stop. We got off on the wrong stop, had to walk a little and caught the next water bus to get to the right stop. It was after 7 and already quite dark. At first it feels a little scary to walk through with your luggage, but we stopped at a store to get directions, and the store owner spoke English and got us quickly back on track. We were a little apprehensive about going down the Calle degli Albanesi because it looks like narrow alley, but the sensor lights came on and guided us through the to the front door. You learn very quickly that these alleyways and paths are part of Venice's unique charm. You have to be buzzed in, and once you get your keys, you are able to open the front door with them. The location is so close to St. Mark's Square and the water taxis, so it's very convenient, but at the same time very quiet. We chose the room with the circular blue windows. We were on the top floor, and there is no elevator. My teenage daughter loved staying in this room. She said it was spacious for just her, and the room was quite cozy. It is a boutique hotel, and even though we had enough room, I hate when people say that these kinds of places are too small. We had the other room with a television and view of the inner courtyard. It was too cold in December to partake in the balcony and rooftop terrace, but it would provide a lovely setting for coffee or resting from the day's activities. There is one computer with free Internet access, and if no one else is looking to use the computer, it was enough. I tried to use it later in the evening and no one else was around. They had a shelf of tour books you can borrow and pamphlets to help plan your outings. Breakfast and service were great. They went out of their way to make us great omelettes and cappuccinos. We also had breads, marmalade, cheese, Nutella, and juice. The staff was very nice and made us feel very comfortable. The hotel owner was great and arranged a free taxi for us to Murano. You should know that any factory tours include a sales pitch at the end, and the water taxi back to your hotel is not free. We took a water bus back and it was fine, but it took a lot longer than the direct water taxi, which is faster but costs a lot more, and is not as scenic. We took a bus that wasn't quite as fast because we left later in the evening, so make sure consult the schedule in your planning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in beautiful Venice!”
Reviews.Author: iheart2trvl
Reviews.Content: Ca' dei Dogi is a very quaint little hotel in the heart of Venice! It has a perfect location right off of the Vaporetto stop and San Marco Square! The service was excellent! They included breakfast which was very tasty omelettes and fresh fruit/yogurt! They did have free wi-fi available but this was only in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Have it all when you stay here!”
Reviews.Author: richkath1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 2 nights before a cruise out of Venice. This little gem is located in a quiet little alleyway, close to everything. You can walk to San Marco square (fabulous at night), the Doge's Palace as well as everywhere in Venice and only a few seconds from the vaporetto stops. We stayed in room 301 with a little terrace off the room. Our view was of the Doge's Palace (the upper level so no one could see us). We had our coffee each morning on the terrace. For being so close to everything, it was absolutely quiet. The morning breakfast was great and included with the room. Why stay anywhere else when you can have everything here? The staff could not have been nicer in helping us get around. You will be happy to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem, must go!”
Reviews.Author: lvpimentel
Reviews.Content: Incredible and great staff!! They were always happy and willing to make our stay as perfect as it was. Thanks a lot to Susanna, who helped us to enjoy Venice even more!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem, wonderful boutique hotel, great location within walking distance to St. Mark's Square,with exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: gocougstac
Reviews.Content: Fabulous boutique hotel, great location, just a short walk to St. Mark's Square, staff were exceptional, delicious breakfast complimentary with room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in the Heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Parlonny
Reviews.Content: If youâ€™re one of the fortunate few to call this place home while visiting the charming city of Venice, then bravo to you. No kidding, this cozy boutique hotel certainly stands out amongst the multitude and offers its patrons comforts rivaling the best in the area. To be sure, this isnâ€™t the Four Seasons (as far as luxury goes anyway) but what Ca Dei Dogi may lack in over-the-top white glove service, it more than compensates for in its personalized attention to its guests with utmost courtesy. Truly, the staff â€“ Stefano, Susana and their team are just simply impeccable. One of the bestâ€”collectivelyâ€” Iâ€™ve encountered in a while. As far as location goes, you canâ€™t do any better. The hotel is conveniently situated right in the heart of historic Venice, just by the main square of Piazza San Marco which includes architectural gem and one of the most important structures in all of Europe, majestic Basilica di San Marco. It is also bordered by Palazzo Ducale â€“ seat of Veniceâ€™s governing body for centuries where itâ€™s said the infamous Casanova was once imprisoned, and several of Veniceâ€™s other highlights. Ca Dei Dogi features 6 rooms all individual decorated to create a more personalized experience for each visitor. They appear to have been recently renovated (at least mine was â€“ a single which though a tad teeny, quite practical enough), and comes equipped with the standards: minibar, coffee/tea, safe, flat panel TVs (including some English channels which seems to be a rarity in Italy) and extra bedding, of course, if needed. Unfortunately there isnâ€™t WiFi access in the rooms; however, this is possible in the reception area. Thereâ€™s also a laptop there for general use with free access to the internet. Additionally, on the top floor, guests can unwind in hotelâ€™s communal terrace. Like most hotels in Italy, breakfast is included with your reservation. But this is no run-of-the-mill buffet-style spread. Indeed, patrons are treated to individually set tables with juices, yogurt, fruit salad, a warmed pastry (usually a croissant), cappuccino made to order and omelets (on demand) â€“ whichever way you like it, your choice of filling. Overall, a lovely experience which added to a thoroughly enjoyable visit. I miss it already and hope to return again someday.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further for perfect location!!!”
Reviews.Author: jeannettevidal
Reviews.Content: What a find! This lovely place is right next to the Doge's palace and bridge of sighs so if location is important to you, this is it. The breakfast is huge for italian standards: omelets made to order, croissants, toast, yogurt, fruit salad, any type of coffee you like, juice, etc. We booked the twin room which is the smallest of all. It was perfect for us but if you are a little big or have more than 2 bags of luggage it will be too small. The entire place is spotless and recently renovated. Nice toiletries in the bathrooms (even toothbrush and toothpaste set!!!). But what really makes this place shine is the staff!!! Warm, welcoming, attentive and always with a smile. If we ever come back to Venice, Ca' dei Dogi will be our base again! ATTENTION make sure you book this hotel and not another one with the same name (odd).

Reviews.Title: “i loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kettletoo
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel - the staff was wonderful and friendly, the location is superb, the rooms were spotless and new and the breakfast was incredible. The room I stayed in (a single room on the third floor was very small, but the other rooms I saw looked like they were an average size. All the rooms I saw were very nicely decorated and maintained. The staff here are very friendly and helpful, and the breakfast they serve was impressive! Add to that the free hot drinks that are available whenever you want in the lobby and you have a perfect place to stay in Venice. I'm so glad I did!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: shangri-lada
Reviews.Content: I booked one night here for my husband and I as we had to fly into Venice to go to Lake Garda as there are no direct flights to Verona in April. We therefore decided to make the most of it and stay in Venice for one night as we hadnt been before, Im so glad we did as the city is beautiful! I found the hotel after reading reviews on here and it was pretty much the only hotel I wanted to book that wasnt ridiculously expensive, but still contemporary and well rated by others. We received a really friendly welcome on arrival and were shown our room on the second floor. It was as i expected, quite small but really clean and a good modern bathroom. I didnt feel the size of the room mattered to us as on city breaks, we are pretty much always out exploring the city. I think the room sizes would only be an isue for people perhaps on a multi-city European trip with lots of luggage! Anyway, the hotel is in a fantastic location, right behind Doges Palace and easy to find. It has a roof terrace in which you may take your own drinks to enjoy although we didnt have time for this during our short stay. Breakfast was ready for us the next morning as soon as we went down for it and was lovely. The hotel restaurant seemed really busy at night so I assume lunch and dinner are pretty good here too! We were only in Venice for 24 hours but felt it was enough time for us to walk around the keys areas and see what we wanted to. The canals and building are all beautiful and its an amazing place to go, if not very expensive!!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: r4reilly
Reviews.Content: great location - very friendly and extremly helpful staff. yes rooms are small but very functional. and most important the rooms + bathrooms were very clean and well maintained. breakfast although tasty , lacked choice and variety. very easy to access from airport - thanks suzanne for all your help during our stay ; ) ... we will recommend to our friends

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, a little overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Linkcd
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, excellent location: just right to Bridge of Sighs and St. Marco. Very lovely room and environment. Stuff is very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is good. A little overpriced, through.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: pyite
Reviews.Content: Best location, fantastic kind service, super clean, and eggs, bacon and tiramasu for breakfast. What more could anyone want?? The folks at this hotel were very sweet, had wonderful recommendations and were incredibly accomodating. Yes... the rooms are small, but they are so well designed to fit all your needs. And if there is anything that the room doesn't have that you need, they will get it for you. You can't get a better location, right next to the piazza, but in a small alleyway so that it feels personal and quiet. Highly recommended. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in best location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: femmenoiredumonde
Reviews.Content: The service of this hotel is really what makes it so special. The location is ideal and Venice really is a very romantic city. I would return here without a doubt on my next trip to Venice. The positive reviews are true and listen to their advice on restaurants and snacks. As a result we had the best meals at decent prices. I would not recommend this hotel for people with children, but great for groups or couples of any age. We stayed three nights and met a couple in their 60's, a single guy and girl (not together), newlyweds and a couple from Italy just passing through, so a great mix of people.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Weekend”
Reviews.Author: GN&CB
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights during February. I would certainly agree with many other reviews to say that the rooms were very clean and well serviced, the welcome was warm and helpful, and the breakfast was delicious. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. I personnally found the bed really hard and did not sleep particularly well. We thought the cost was high in comparison to other European cities, as we stayed in central Prague the previous month for half the price, but I guess thats Venice for you and it was also festival time. We had a wonderful weekend in the sunshine, but would have wished for better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely amenities, great location, so welcoming... I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: citylifemomma
Reviews.Content: Just steps from St. Mark's square, this place is really tucked away down a romantic narrow alley. Follow the directions carefully or you'll miss it. Several of our small (12) travel group stayed here. At the last minute, my traveling companion had to cut out of the tour early so I was alone when I checked in. The manager seemed more crestfallen than I was at the news (although it truly is sad for anyone to miss a chance to see Venice.) He provided me with a complimentary bottle of prosecco to ease my disappointment. The amenities here are downright luxurious. More like a Marriott or Hilton than the dowdy but functional B&Bs and pensiones I'm used to in Italy. Price is of course more than those humbler places, but not outrageous. They serve a terrific breakfast, too, with espresso or cappuchino, flaky croissant, fresh fruit, yogurt and omelets any way you like them -- all included in the price when I stayed there. That said, my one disappointment was that other than breakfast, the restaurant was only average. It is surprisingly difficult to find a really great restaurant in Venice. The restaurant seemed geared toward serving huge boatloads of tourists as quickly as possible. If booking this hotel, be very careful that you are getting the correct Ca Dei Dogi as there are several hotels that have this name and this is definitely the one you want.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, wonderfully romantic”
Reviews.Author: DRinlondon
Reviews.Content: The Ca' dei dogi was part of my birthday weekend present and my other half couldn't have found a more romantic, better located place in Venice. A few paces away from the waterfront and literally a couple of minutes' walk from the piazza San Marco and the Bridge of Sighs, this is a delightful base from which to explore wonderful Venice. We stayed in the Jacuzzi room which had its own private balcony (and a jacuzzi of course!) and this was a wonderful way to unwind with a glass of Prosecco, which can be ordered from reception. The room itself was not huge but was cosy, clean and nicely furnished. The hotel displayed lovely pieces from local artists and guests can use the laptop at reception for internet access. The omelettes served at breakfast were the best I've ever tasted and the coffee was fantastic. Staff were very nice and the manager/owner recommended a wonderful Venetian restaurant called La Mascareta. Visitors are better off going with the owner's suggestions because restaurants in Venice can be a bit of a rip off. Venice was fantastic and our stay at Ca' dei dogi made it all the more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: 7mima
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, over New Years Eve 2010. Single room was very tiny - but looked exactly like I expected it to and was clean. Staff were terrific - I had lost my voice and couldn't speak, but they did their absolute best to help me and provide me with dining suggestions. Location is PERFECT, and surprisingly quiet. I will stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for Venice!”
Reviews.Author: emerina_bakkes
Reviews.Content: I would definitely describe this hotel as perfect for Venice ... it has a great location, very close to the plaza and the wonderfully romantic gondolas. It is (understandably) quite small, but the rooms are comfortable and warm. They have a great restaurant where I ate the most delicious lasagne in the world! The service is fantastic ... one minute after arriving they learned of a cancelling and offered us an upgraded room without extra pay. They also provided us with a nice private breakfast at 5 in the morning so that we will not be late for our waterbus at 05h50. There is no other place that I will stay at if we visit Venice again...it's great!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location - easy to find!”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysARunnerGirl
Reviews.Content: There is a main canal stop named San Zaccaria which is minutes away from this hotel. The directions that I was provided from the hotel were spot-on. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, though we did receive wrong directions more than once (meaning they marked on the map where they thought a restaurant was, but it was not there). We still appreciated the effort. one staff member even called and made a walking tour reservation for us! Looks-wise, it was the nicest place we stayed in Italy (we stayed in Rome and Florence as well). One shower head was broken and we didn't have much hot water. When I asked about it, they did take care of it eventually, but they said the water 'felt fine to them'. The room was SO HOT that we kept our windows open (mind you, we were there in November) and at one point, I got out of bed and hung my head out the window. VERY uncomfortable. We inquired about turning down our heat which they did, but it didn't help until the people on the same floor as us checked out. The breakfast is touch-and-go. Our first day, we were waited on in a timely manner. The second day, no one was around and our breakfast took ~ 45 minutes. The third day a staff member cooked for us, which worked out just fine. I would pass on the restaurant, there are many choices out there! Considering this was the most expensive place we stayed by over double than Rome and Florence, we both found our stay at this hotel wasn't worth the price and we enjoyed our other two cheaper places that we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with amazing staff in a great location”
Reviews.Author: lcamarena5
Reviews.Content: The Ca' dei Dogi is a small hotel right off the grand canal and right around the corner from the St Mark's Square. Although, yes the rooms are small compared to US standards, they are roomy and quite standard by European standards, as well as fully equipped with plenty of amenities. Very nice bathroom/shower. The staff is incredible and accommodating of all circumstances. Morning breakfast is much more then I expected, and included a wonderful omelette and more then I could eat. Susanna is such a pleasure. Her recommendations were all wonderful, and she made my wife and I feel like we were at home with good friends, not in a hotel. I would recommend the Ca' dei Dogi to anyone and I will stay here again when I return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: cdl3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a wonderful find thanks to Tripadvisor. I can only repeat the comments of satisfied customers. Not five minutes from San Marco and the Doge's palace it is a haven of peace. All the staff were welcoming and very helpful throughout our stay. customer care is a priority here. Our room was the Batik, very comfortable and clean with a delightful terrace and gorgeous marble bathroom with high quality fittings. Breakfast was included in the room price and was more than ample - be sure not to miss the delicious omelettes made to order. We had dinner in the adjoining restaurant on our first night which we also enjoyed. We had a wonderful short break in Venice, would love to return and would definitely stay again at the Ca' dei Dogi. Thank you to Stefano, Susanna and all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Friendly Staff, Modern Rooms”
Reviews.Author: 24traveling2day
Reviews.Content: As 99 percent of the reviewers have said, this is a little jewel in an absolutely perfect location. It is unbelieveable close to San Marco and the Dogi Palace and yet very quiet and away from the mass of people. We choose this one based on location as my wife has mobility problems. But, we were impressed with the clean, well appointed rooms (although on the small side). The breakfasts were good and large. We found the staff friendly and very helpful. A couple cautions; there is no elevator, rooms are small by US standards, there is basically no lobby, its not cheap, and can be a little difficult to locate. But, the positives far outweighed the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in the centre of Venice”
Reviews.Author: ttrip10
Reviews.Content: Location is very good, central, easy to get to from water taxi. We stayed in the well presented apartment, everything you could need, friendly hosts without being intrusive.

Reviews.Title: “From our rooftop apartment deck, I thought I was in heaven. I know I was.”
Reviews.Author: adriscol01
Reviews.Content: What great fortune to find Ca dei Dogi and its' awesome innkeepers Susanna and Stefano! They gave us great tips on restaurants, tours and shopping, including a trip by free private taxi to tour a glass factory on the island of Murano. Our apartment was incredible...we were literally in the clouds. It was heaven.

Reviews.Title: “3 star hotel at 5 star prices”
Reviews.Author: dglegends
Reviews.Content: Like most of Venice, this hotel is a rip-off. The staff was unhelpful when we tried to find a restaurant outside the hotel. They do not keep sample menus and had no suggestions. The was no internet service in our part of the hotel. The desk clerk said we could use the hotel computer at the front desk to check our email but only after 9:00PM. Breakfast was not included and was priced at 20 Euros each for a menu only slightly better than the Holiday Inn. When we had a housekeeping issue that required a change of linens, we asked (at 6:00) if they could wait until we left for dinner at 7:00 only to be informed that that would "not be convenient" for the housekeeping staff, which showed up at our door while we were trying to get ready for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “It is a priceless gem beyond words.”
Reviews.Author: Achie
Reviews.Content: Firstly, the location...it's right behind Palazzo Ducale (Doge's Palace) and Piazza San Marco. So, it's a very, very convenient base to explore Venice. The ferry stop (San Zaccaria) is less than a minute walk from the hotel. Even though the hotel is so close to Piazza San Marco, it is located in an alley that is very quiet so you can definitely get a good night's sleep. I recommend spending some time (coffee/tea time) on the rooftop terrace while enjoying the sound of the bells of San Marco. It's a very relaxing and tranquil experience for me. Secondly, everyone working there is sincerely warm and helpful. Susanna welcomed me on my first day and gave me tons of useful information about shopping for souvenirs, particularly, Murano glass. Please don't hesitate to ask her for advice, she will do it wholeheartedly, patiently, and with a big smile. I also got to check-in earlier since the room was already ready! What a welcome relief since I just had an early morning 2-hour train ride from Florence! Stefano was also very friendly and patient with all my inquiries. I tend to ask many questions but these people deserve awards for patience and helpfulness. Michael, the night manager, was also very helpful and friendly. He prepares the breakfast for the guests and makes a very yummy omelet. Thirdly, the room...I stayed in a single room which had a view of the front of the hotel. It was small BUT it was just perfect for me. The room smelled nice (like cinnamon, which I adore) and was immaculate. Thanks to Ruby, the housekeeping staff! You also get free coffee and tea in the room. The bathroom is up to the standards of a 5-star hotel. It's big enough for one person and everything was so shiny and clean. I could have moved in to that room permanently if given the chance. Fourthly, I recommend eating at the restaurant Taverna de Dogi, which is adjacent to the hotel. From what I have heard, this restaurant was started by the hotel owner's parents and it's very popular with tour groups. But, don't let this deter you from going there because even for a solo diner like me, they were able to give me a secluded spot to enjoy my meal. I recommend the risotto con nero (not sure about the spelling but it is rice with the ink from cuttlefish) and tiramisu. Very delicious! Even now, I am still gushing about my stay at this gem of a hotel. It makes my stay in Venice a truly unforgettable experience. I'll definitely stay here again if I go back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: jzgreens
Reviews.Content: Located literally around the corner from Saint Mark's Square, it is a great location. Venice is very walkable. Breakfast (and lunch) are awesome. Room was small, but clean. Very nice bathroom/shower. Service was fantastic. Venice itself is a tourist trap, so it was great to find this quaint bed and breakfast right in the heart of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A small hotel that is big on comfort”
Reviews.Author: lyanna501
Reviews.Content: Ca' dei Dogi provided a wonderful stay in Venice for us. It is steps from the promenade and lagoon and very close to St. Mark's Square. The hotel has small but lovely rooms and attached patios. In addition, there is a wonderful roof deck at the top of the building. Breakfast is served in a room of the attached restaurant Taverna Dei Dogi, which also serves lunch and dinner. Susanna and Stefano run the hotel beautifully and made our stay extra nice.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for your stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Morethanamom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Venice for 3 days before boarding a ship for the trip of a lifetime with our family. The location is perfect. Very near St. Mark's Square, but tucked behind in a hidden alley. Very quiet. Rooms are quite small, but we were hardly in them. There were 8 of us in our party and I think we booked every room. Susanna and Stefano were great hosts. They treated us just like we were staying in their home. I can't imagine staying anyplace else if we have the chance to return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: grateful_travels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful honeymoon stay at Ca' dei Dogi. Stefano and Susanna are very gracious hosts, extremely friendly and helpful and really went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. Ca' dei Dogi is in a wonderful location - literally about a 2 minute walk from Piazza San Marco, as well as both the San Marco and San Zaccaria vaporetto stops, yet still tucked away in an alleyway that offers seclusion and a quiet reprieve from the large crowds of tourists. From the terrace attached to our room, we could see the Doge's Palace - just on the backside of the building across from us - and the Campanile tower just beyond that. It is also a very short walk to the Rialto Bridge/Grand Canal, with the route clearly marked by arrows from Piazza San Marco. (These arrows also made it nice if you got lost because there was another set pointing back to Piazza San Marco and it's very easy to find your way back to the hotel from there.) We stayed in the Batik room. It was quite small, but not impossibly small. We traveled with two carry-on sized roller bags and a small backpack, and we had no trouble whatsoever fitting all of our luggage in the room with space to still move around. It's not the largest hotel room around, but it has the basics, and isn't by any means a closet. The bed was a little hard for our liking, but we found this to be the case everywhere we stayed in Italy. The bathroom is also quite small - very long and narrow without much space to move around - but it has the basics, and was very clean and functional. Our room had a small terrace with a table and two chairs. The terrace was fairly small as well, but very nice for the two of us to sit and enjoy a glass of wine and our surroundings in the evenings. There was also a small TV, though it only had one channel in English (BBC), and free wireless internet on the first floor. We took our laptop down to the cafe outside, but there is also a computer in the lobby for guests' use (free of charge). There is also a restaurant attached to the hotel. The restaurant serves continental breakfast in the mornings, included in the price of the room. We had huge, delicious omelets cooked any way we wanted, croissants, fruit, yogurt, coffee, juice - way more food than we could even eat. We also ate dinner in the restaurant one night - it is a 10% discount for guests - and the food was really good. We got great service and the prices were decent as well. Overall, despite the somewhat small quarters of the room, we loved our stay at Ca' dei Dogi. We appreciated the hospitality of Stefano and Susanna and their willingness to help us plan our days' activities, meals, etc. The location was also a huge win. We would recommend a stay at Ca' dei Dogi to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Practically Perfect”
Reviews.Author: JimnArizona
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to Venice and we had a terrific stay at the Ca'dei Dogi. Practically in St Marks square, but the backalley location makes it nice and quiet. Right off the Riga and close to multiple vaporetto stops and the airport Alilaguna. We were on the second floor in an Economy double and were quite pleased. Small but modern rooms with nice decor. Lobby computer, modern bathrooms, A/C, generous breakfast. Staff was friendly and responsive. We unpacked into the drawers and closets, stashed the suticases under the bed and had PLENTY of room ( I think alot of people that have problems in small hotels fail to take this simple step). If I return to Venice there is no question I will try and book here first.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic small hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: John3911
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is a real treasure. Easy to get to, located right behind Doges palace and you can see the Bridge of Sighs from the hotel. Very comfortable rooms with a super friendly multi-lingual staff. A good value in a Venice hotel with a nice courtyard for breakfast served at your leisure. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem - Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Samson6
Reviews.Content: This charming little family run hotel was in a fabulous location, close to the water taxis and a very short walk to San Marco's square. Susanna was extremely hospitable and helpful. She speaks great English and recommended delicious restaurants. We travelled through Italy for a month and this hotel had the BEST breakfast. The omelets cooked to your liking were excellent, fresh croissants, fruit salad, toast and yoghurt. Free WI-FI. Rooms were small (but this is very normal for Venice) but very clean and cozy. We also had some excellent food and lots of laughs with the staff at the restaurant next to the hotel. We fell in love with Venice and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, superb customer service and good value”
Reviews.Author: kstraveler81
Reviews.Content: Excellent location right next to Bridge of Sighs and 1/10 of mile from Saint Mark's Square and the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop. The people at the front desk, Susana and Stefano, were extremely helpful, spoke English well and provided great restaurant recommendations. Breakfasts are very good and include made to order omelettes. The one drawback - the rooms are on the small side. Room 101 is the smallest in the hotel and you may want to avoid that room unless yuu are traveling solo or traveling very light as there is limited space to store your luggage. If location and service is important to you, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny hotel close to St. Mark's Square”
Reviews.Author: lindsayross82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I started our Italy trip at the Ca'Dei Dogi Hotel. Because we were watching our costs but wanted to stay on the island, we opted for the double room with two single beds. The room was clean and simple. Very small and not very romantic. We were on the main floor right beside the check-in desk. Even though intially we were a bit worried about being so close to reception, there were no issues with the noise levels. The location was great but don't expect any views. The breakfast was mediocre (too much oil in the eggs!). If you are not looking for luxury but instead a comfortable, clean and friendly hotel in a great location, this hotel would be highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “More like a hotel than a B&B!”
Reviews.Author: melach9_2009
Reviews.Content: What an excellent B&B!! If it had more rooms it would have been an excellent hotel. Location, quality of the room facilities - just too good!! My wife and I stayed there for 3 nights, and it was just wonderful. From the wonderful host, Susanna, to the staff which were always willing to help. (We think, we only caught a fleeting glance of Stefano.) The breakfast was superb - omelete cooked to your preference, and the full on continental breakfast provided us with enough energyto explore the most wonderful city that Venice is! The B&B is just a very short stroll to San Marco Square, and just a skip to the vaporettos(water buses) but very quiet from the tourist crowds. It is also just less than 10 minutes walk to the Rialto Bridge. It's tucked away in a little courtyard which is just a left and right turn from the water's edge. There is a restaurant on the premises which can get very crowded for dinner. Food there is as good as any, and not exorbitantly priced. You get a discount if you are staying at the B&B.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: lepotage
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. The room was beautiful ,elegant, impeccably clean and large even by North American standards. Were able to book the room on short notice at 120 euro a night for the junior suite. Three large windows overlooking the canal, seperate sitting area, good air conditioning and comfortable bed. Lots of attention to detail, including the lovely toiletries in the bathroom, heated towel rack and even the drinks from the mini-bar in the room, usually over-priced, were a good deal at 50% off the regular price in July. Nice breakfast, served by gracious owners, canal side. All in all good value and great experience. Would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful from start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: TeachinCa
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time in Venice, and staying at Ca' dei Dogi made it even better! First of all, the directions are great! Arriving by vaporetto from the train station, getting off at St. Marks Square, and then walking the narrow streets to the hotel couldn't have been easier. Check-in was fast & friendly, and our room was modern, but charming...good bed, bathroom, plenty of storage..just right! We looked forward to our breakfasts everyday (wonderful omelettes!) and the staff treated us like we were guests in their home! We're so very happy that we stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very comfortable, terrific staff, great value!!!”
Reviews.Author: lightning411
Reviews.Content: The owner Stephano & Susanna were extremely pleasant, knowledgable and helpful. They were genuinely interested in making a guest feel comfortable. This was quite apparent via emails we had sent while evaluating where to stay. They were always curteous and responsive. The included breakfast was really nice. We (wife/17 year old daughter and 12 year old son) stayed in the top floor apartment across from the main hotel/restaurant. It was spacious enough and had a full kitchen and balcony/terrace. It was quiet and realxing. My son has a dairy allergy and they were very careful to provide food that he could eat in their restaurant. The hotel is just over a1 minute walk down the alley to the main lagoon at San Zaccaria which is next to St. Mark square. In fact, it is behind the 5 star Hotel Danieli. Of course you could spend 3 times (or more) for that hotel or enjoy the wonderful value and hospitality of this hotel. We were fortunate to find this gem and were quite happy with our decision to stay there. We highly recommend this place if you are visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: cdnliving
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (children 16, 14) stayed here for three nights and it was absolutely delightful. The rooms were tastefully decorated, although small they were efficiently designed, and very clean. The morning breakfast was one of the best we had throughout Italy - fresh pastries, yogurt, fruit salad, coffee, juices and custom made omlettes. A perfect location, close to St. Marks. And above all else, the owners Stefano and Susanna and ALL of the staff were amazing - always charming and attentive - we felt like family thanks to their kind hospitality. Thankyou Stefano, Susanna and everyone at Ca' dei Dogi for a wonderful stay!!

Reviews.Title: “They really know how to take care of you at the Ca dei Dogi”
Reviews.Author: LZ12345
Reviews.Content: Ca dei Dogi has a great location right near St. Marks, but it feels like it's in its own secluded area...which is nice in Venice in the summer. The hotel is modern and very clean and very well taken care of. All the necessities are readily available. The staff is really helpful and so nice to deal with. They were all a pleasure. The rooms are small...but it is Venice, so not much to do about that. The breakfast was really nice as well. They really know how to take care of you at the Ca Dei Dogi!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and very Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: NorthTexas76226
Reviews.Content: We spent June 11-14 at Ca' dei Dogi and this was a great place. Perfect location off of the Grand Canal with boat stops very close and about a block away from St. Marks's square. There are great places to eat everywhere and we simply would walk and get lost and then look for a place to have dinner. The staff here were very accomodating and friendly. The free breakfast was very good and the wait service were great. The room was slightly on the small side, but we managed just fine. Free internet access was available in their lobby on their laptop. This is a great place in a perfect location where you will be treated well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: greycott
Reviews.Content: I am really only repeating what everyone else has said, its in a great location, the staff are fantastic very helpful and friendly. It has a beautiful clean modern interior. Our downstairs room was very small but planned very carefully so that everything fitted in. We loved it and it was our favourite hotel on our european trip. And we loved the fact that we got omlette for breakfast made a lovely change for us.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, Excellent Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: alexfi24
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just stayed at Ca' dei Dogi for two nights this week. It was my birthday and we chose Ca'dei Dogi for its intimate accommodations, excellent and attentive staff and perfect location. Susanna and Stefano were amazingly helpful as my boyfriend planned a special birthday dinner for me and as we needed to plan our transportation options during a massive transportation strike. Also, we went to Lido and rented bikes, which Susanna helped us arrange. It was the perfect way to spend a day!! We had a Superior Room one night and a Jacuzzi Room the second night. I preferred the Superior Room (less expensive, actually) as it had a sweet sitting room and a nice shower with lots of shower heads. The Jacuzzi room had a bigger bathroom but only a bathtub, no shower. And the bed in the Superior Room was softer than the bed in the Jacuzzi room. The breakfast was awesome- great croissants, nutella, lovely fruit salad and yogurt, and omelets if you want. The cappuccinos were dark and strong. You are right around the corner from St. Mark's square with this hotel. It's perfect. I was just thrilled with this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charmy and Modern in great Venice location”
Reviews.Author: ricksriot
Reviews.Content: Originally booked 2 nights but there was an error with the system and only 1 took . This was caught only days before our arrival. Stefano, the owner, was completely apologetic and had secured another hotel he knew well, around the corner, at the same price. He even promised to move our luggage for us (huge help when you realize how hard it it to lug heavy suitcases up 6 flights of very narrow stairs)! When we arrived he had a bottle of sparkling wine for us. Everything worked out fine....but we would have preferred spending both nights in Ca' dei Dogi as the accommodations were a big step above everything else. Modern, tasteful decor. Clever use of space. A real queen/king bed (not 2 twins pushed together). A bed with some cushion to it......anyone else notice that Italian hotels have the hardest beds in Europe? The bathrooms are clean, modern, and a shower that I would love to have in my own home. Breakfast was very good - you could also request a cooked omelette at no charge. Plus, an actual computer with free internet access to guests. Stefano was the nicest and most hospitable proprietor you could ask for. Would definitely stay here again and heartily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Venice, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandyGeoff
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in early June and throughly enjoyed this hotel experience. We stayed in room 301, batik. Yes, the room was small, but it was gorgeous and comfortable. And we loved the peacfullness of our private balcony with potted flowers, table, chairs, and candle in hurricane lantern - the perfect spot for midafternoon or after dinner glass of wine. The bathroom was tight for space, but again beautifully decorated and fully functional. As noted in other reviews, breakfast was excellent, and do have dinner here, as well. Very convenient location. Overall, the service was very good, but some staff were happier to help with information about the hotel and city than others. Also, after the booking, inquiries made by e-mail (about recommended restaurants and advice on airport transfer services) did not receive a response. Regardless, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: megs4220
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the Jacuzzi rooms with the patio overlooking a garden. The location was great- very close to St Marks square and within walking distance to pretty much everything. It was also very close to one of the stops on the water, so it was very convenient and easy getting to it from the airport. The room was kinda small- not a lot of space around the bed, but the bathroom was pretty large. Only complaint about the bathroom was that it didn't have a shower. It had a shower head attached to the Jacuzzi that you just had to hold over your head in order to shower and rinse. The bed was also pretty hard- but we found that it was typical of most beds in the hotels we stayed at while in Italy. The room was pretty expensive- but we found that was typical of Venice: small rooms for more money than other places. The breakfast was really good- good coffee and pastries and omelets (this was the only place we stayed at that offered omelets). Overall, the staff was friendly and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Venice's Best Small Hotel--don't tell your friends!”
Reviews.Author: braesides
Reviews.Content: Spent a wonderful few days at the Ca' dei Dogi earlier this month with my adult daughter. As reported elsewhere, the rooms are small but have everything you need through ingenious design. Susanne and Stefan are lovely, warm and helpful hosts. The hot breakfast is more than you expect and the roof top patio is a great place to get a bird's eye view of the surroundings while relaxing with a glass of wine after a day of sightseeing. What is amazing is that this quiet oasis is literally five minutes from San Marco plazza, a huge number of tavernas, the vaporetto, the Grand Canal and a full range of shopping choices. It is a treat to slip back to your room after a busy round of seeing the sites and drop your packages, change your shoes, or just sit for a bit before getting ready for some new sites. A word to the wise: if you are from North America you will not recognize the Calle degli Albanesi as a street--it is only around two metres wide tucked between two buildings. Do not be concerned and take what appears to be an alley but is the street off which the hotel is located. While I would love to keep this jewel to myself, it really should be shared with others. This hotel deserves all the accolades and business that it gets!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Holleeds
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my daughter over the May Day Bank Holiday weekend. It is in the perfect location. The twin room was small but had everything we needed and more besides. There was an amazing use of space. One night there was a problem with the hot water but we were immediately offered a bottle of sparkling wine whilst we waited for it to heat up - we were perfecty happy with the outcome!

Reviews.Title: “A special place to stay with such friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Purdy006
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to Venice which was extended due to the volcanic ash cloud. We are so thankful that we chose to stay at Ca' dei Dogi as the hotel staff did their upmost to help us deal with this problem, kindly holding a room for us, ringing our airline, advising on a nearby train booking agent and even preparing a breakfast at 4.30am before we left. Ca' dei Dogi is in a fantastic location, behind bustling St. Mark square, yet in the opposite direction you can wondering around the quiet allies of Castello. Ca' dei Dogi sets you up for the day with a hearty breakfast including delicious omlettes and after a busy day exploring venice the sunny roof terrace is a relaxing retreat. We stayed in two rooms during our extended stay, Batik room with its own balcony and the twin room on the ground floor. Both rooms were impeccably clean with a slick design making use of every space available.. The icing on the cake for Ca'dei Dogi is the service we received from Susanna, Stefano and Michael and we cannot thank them enough for their kind hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: saveryc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Venice for two nights during a 12-day excursion throughout France and Italy. This hotel was probably my favorite of all the hotels. The service was excellent, the hotel was quiet, and the breakfast was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel just at the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: ElFranjo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ca' dei Dogi four nights in March 2010. The experience was Excellent (capital E). All the other reviews are not exaggerating. The location is superb, a mere 2-3 minutes (if that) to Piazza San Marco, in fact our window looked to the back of the Palazzo Ducale. Plus, the stops of all vaporettos were even closer. We had the "jacuzzi" room. It was smallish (apparently like all in Venice) but very nice, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was very nice, large and apparently quite new (and with the Jacuzzi). Our room had a little balcony. The roof terrace looked to the Palazzo Ducale backside. The people (Susanna and her husband) were very kind and extremely helpful. She told us about where to find good (and genuine) Murano glass, about the vaporettos, how to bargain with gondoliers, etc. The breakfast was really nice: cappuccino (of course), omelet made to order with ham and cheese, croissants, yogurt, fruit salad, bread etc. There is free internet in a laptop at reception. We thoroughly recommend the hotel. BTW, if you search for it in Google maps, with the "official" address "Corte Santa Scolastica, Castello, Venice", is not the first result you get, but the second ("Ca' Dei Dogi S.A.S. Di Dardano Maria & C."). Also, if you search for the street leading to the hotel, either "calle degli albanesi" or "calle dei albanesi", google takes you to the wrong street, apparently there is more than one "dei albanesi" in Venice. However, if you zoom into the hotel, you will see the street name correctly.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant - our only 5 star review for our Italian trip”
Reviews.Author: love2travelTokyo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights - one of 8 hotels we stayed during our Italian trip (mix of 3-5 stars). Fabulous boutique hotel, value, location and service. 5 star location, 4 star facilities, 3 star prices. Believe the other reviews...will definitely stay again if we ever make it back to Venice. DEFINITELY RECOMMENDED. Pros - We were very lucky to get upgraded to the apartment, but from what we saw, all the rooms would be furnished the same. Modern furnishings and very clean. Owner Stefano has a Japanese wife and that standard of Japanese cleanliness shows through! Definitely more like 4 star than 3 star. If you are luck enough to have the apartment, it is very spacious and even has a gorgeous terrace looking out to the palace - LOCATION! Hidden just round the corner from St Marks square, close to so many restaurants etc. I would have expected to pay so much more to have such a central location.
