And it's not that hard to find - down a small quiet alley...just that the street sign you turn down to get to the hotel may not be obvious walking from the vaporetto stop (the street sign is visible if you walk in the other direction ie from St Marks square) - Service - Susanna at the front desk was very helpful...probably the best service we had in all of Italy. The owner Stefano was lovely too and dropped by at our dinner at the restaurant to offer free aperitif and post-dinner drinks! The restaurant staff were all very nice too. All very personalised too seeing there are only 6 rooms I think? - Value - really just astounding value....i have paid a lot more before for a lot less...and seen many 4 and even 5 star places that are worse. Free internet as well downstairs - Breakfast was great - continental + omelette cooked to order Cons - The bed could have been a bit more comfortable Other Tips - The hotel restaurant is actually pretty good and great value. But generally, Venice food is more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the location and people too...”
Reviews.Author: vague travellers
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said, a spot just around the corner from St Marco's square, quite close to the vaporetto stop etc is a brilliant way to be placed in Venice. We too enjoyed the computer provided for guests' use and the suggestions about restaurants and other things to do. They were particularly concerned for us when we decided to go to one of the more upmarket restauarants for one meal. They gave us some suggestions as to what to look out for to stop getting a surprise on the bill. The rooms were on the small side, although comfortable and with it raining in Venice while we were there, it did mean that we didnt want to spend too much time in them. But again, that is Venice by and large, and who goes to Venice to stay in their room? As we said, the rooms were comfortable and we would be very happy to return again when we visit Venice next!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the apartment at Ca dei Dogi”
Reviews.Author: lalabbott
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed in the apartment at Ca dei Dogi for four nights during Carnivale. We absolutely loved it. From check-in to check-out, the owners and staff at the hotel and restaurant were unbelievably friendly and helpful. The apartment was so close to everything, St Marks Square, the vaporettos to the Lagoon, the market and museums--we walked everywhere. We awoke each morning to the bells in St Marks Square. There is a computer available for guests in the lobby, free of charge, pretty rare nowadays. If (actually, when) I return to Venice I will definitely stay at Ca dei Dogi again. My only teeny-tiny criticism: the breakfast in the restaurant is great but the options are a bit too sweetened even for our American tastes. :-) Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, highly recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: PeteandSiobhan
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Ca Dei Dogi - and just as perfect as the last. We were upgraded to a room with an outdoor terrace. Room was small but comfortable and clean. The bathroom was also on the smaller side but the heated towel racks were certainly a bonus in the cold winter weather. Breakfast was a highlight every morning with a good selection of toast, jams, fruit, yoghurt, pastries, omlettes cooked to order and juices and coffee. Hotel is well located a 2 minute walk from St Marks Square. The staff, particularly Stefano and Susanna are extremely friendly and helpful. Would thoroughly recommend to anyone visiting Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing small boutique hotel, with a very personal touch!”
Reviews.Author: Antnee77
Reviews.Content: This place was amazing. Perfect location in a small, narrow walkway. Secluded, yet literally steps from Piazza San Marco. The room was spacious and beautiful, and also brand new. The bathroom was the same, clean and new, as well as tastefully furnished. The staff was also extremely kind and welcoming. From what I remember, it was run by a husband and wife who provided excellent dinner suggestions. We were directed toward a dinner spot that was crowded with locals and not tourists where we had the most amazing Bistecca Fiorentina! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: sdc65
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel, the adventure to find it, is certainly worth the reward. The roomâ€™s are cozy the staff are friendly and location couldnâ€™t be better. I did not go to Venice for the hotel but it certainly was something to remember. The morning breakfast was great, the amount and variety of food was amazing. Follow the directions supplied on the website and you wonâ€™t go wrong. SDC Alberta, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Don't tell anyone!”
Reviews.Author: Pasc0
Reviews.Content: Do not tell anyone about this little gem of an hotel - it will be full next time we want to return! The location of Ca'dei Dogi could not be bettered; it is perhaps a 90 second walk from San Zaccaria vaporetto jetty and about the same to St Mark's Square. Stefano and Susanna could not have been more helpful with their advice, maps and recommendations. Breakfast was of excellent quality and quantity - it is served in a dining room attached to the Hotel's restaurant. There is also free internet access at reception. Make sure to climb to the very top of the Hotel and enjoy the view over the Bridge of Sighs - it is a perfect spot for a quiet read, snooze or pre-dinner drink. Our room was comfortable albeit "squeezy"with the Queen size bed pushed against the wall. The bathroom was clean with an excellent , if complicated ,shower . And I am a plumber! Be prepared to walk everywhere, get lost and have endless adventures on your way back to the Hotel. The vaporetto passes are great value and don't just limit yourself to the Grand Canal; the ferries will take you to The Lido, the islands of Murano and Burano and as far afield as Chioggia. This a delightful Hotel in a wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, great location,superb service”
Reviews.Author: Gricper
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in late October. The room was on the small side but superbly equipped. The breakfast should hardly be called continental with fruit, yoghurt, croissants and great omelletes. Best of all is the location - only a minute or so from St Mark's Square. The hosts and staff can't do too much for you so all in all its probably the nicest place to stay in Venice. As for Venice its lovely but VERY expensive. Best tip is to buy a vaporetto pass for all of your stay as they go everywhere and the pass is good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: stheo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a wonderful location and the owners including the rest of the staff are so nice and friendly. The breakfast they offer is great! Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Apartment!”
Reviews.Author: Steve_and_Megann
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from 5 days in Venice, where we stayed at the apartment which is part of the Ca' dei Dogi. I have nothing but good things to say about it! It is spacious, clean, near all the necesary transportation links, and Stefano and Susanna are gracious hosts. It is not for those with mobility issues, as you must climb 6 flights to get there, but that helps balance the large breakfast which the hotel provides! The hotel was kind enough to carry our luggage to and from the apartment. In addition to the large "matrimonial" bedroom, there is a combined kitchen, sitting and eating area, with a futon if there are more than 2 of you. the kitchen is equipped well enough for you to prepare meals, which we recommend you try, as Venice restaurants are quite expensive. We went to the pecheria, or fish market on our first day and picked up a nice piece of fish, fresh vegetables, fresh pasta and wine. It was a terrific meal. On our final night we got some fresh veal from a nearby butcher, recommended by the restaurant, along with some fresh mushrooms, and made a mushroom risotto to go along with the veal. Did I mention that we ate this on the terrace which overlooks the Doge's Palace! The only complaint is not about the apartment but about the giant Geox ad which surrounds the Bridge of Sighs, almost making it disappear, and lights up the entire area! We walked almost every part of Venice in 5 days, throughly enjoying every step, even the ones that lead in the "wrong" direction. Getting lost in Venice is guaranteed. As long as you know how to get home from the Rialto or San Marco you'll be fine. We would recommend this apartment to anyone who is not intimidated by the stairs. Even if you are tired when you get to the top, it's simply a good excuse to relax together, have a glass of wine and enjoy independent living in a lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel experience, why isn't every hotel like this?”
Reviews.Author: LancashireSailor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ca dei Dogi for two nights after a cruise on Grand Princess. Susanna and Stefano were very helpful and friendly, the hotel was perfect, having stepped off a cruise ship the room was not too small and even had its own quirky balcony. It was quiet, tucked down an alley, and only steps from San Zaccariah vaporetto stop and San Marco Piazza.We even got a complimentary coffee on arrival, whilst the maid did our room. Breakfast was delicious, croissants juices and a fresly prepared omelette. The free internet access was useful for booking seats on the return flight. This little hotel just speaks quality. Forget the Danieli next door, our cases went there from the ship and they were unhelpful and the manager was downright rude-I would never stay there after that. Stay at Ca Dei Dogi. It ticks all the boxes.Thanks to S&S for a terrific two days.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: Diablu1
Reviews.Content: Very small and cozy hotel. It is around the corner from Piazza San Marco. Stephen and Susan made us feel right at home the minute we arrived. The rooms are small, but after all, you only sleep there, the rest of the time your are experiencing Venice. Great price, had a very apetizing breakfasts, and coffee included. The restaurant meal was good and you get a 10% discount. Internet is FREE! Best place in Venice, very satisfied. And the people attending us were great. Next ITME in Venice, no other place to go but Ca 'dei Dogi!

Reviews.Title: “Everything but the size”
Reviews.Author: ConnecticutSkitch
Reviews.Content: The only issue is room size. We were in the Jacuzzi room, and there wasn't enough floor space to open two suitcases. Otherwise, a terrific place--location, quality of furnishing, owners.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel, Hosts and Location”
Reviews.Author: sandbagger27
Reviews.Content: Found the Ca Dei' Dogi on the Traveol Advisor prior to our trip....Former reviews were "spot on" as they say....Susanna and Sefano are wonderful hosts....Rooms were spotless, bathrooms modern and up-class!!!....Rooms in this B&B/Inn type residence are a bit smaller, however, saying that, all three that we had offered something special such a balcony view or other amenties. In a side passage way next to the Bridge of Sighs. WiFI available in the lobby if you have your own laptop or Stefano and Susanna provide one for your convenience to check e-mails, plane reservations and so forth....a nice touch. Restaurant attached is wonderful with an excellent breakfast provided in the room charge. We also had had wonderful evening meal there as well for the five of us... Located next to Piazza San Marco , Vaporetto boat stops and all activities....Could not find a better and more convenient hotel....Should you choose the Ca Dei' Dogi you won't be displeased!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice.”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte46
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Great location, helpful staff, and the best breakfast we had all week. Nice room with small balcony. Hotel also has a nice balcony that all guests have access to.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Supertravelbee
Reviews.Content: We really had a good time at this place. Perfect place to stay in Venice. The owners of the hotel are so friendly, we really felt home! They can give you the best recommandation for restaurants where the locals eat. We re going back! Thanks, for the nice stay and time in Venice!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: DaveandKylee
Reviews.Content: We loved this place! The staff made us feel at home as soon as we arrived and nothing was too much trouble. The location simply can't be beaten. The room was fresh and spacious with a great bathroom and it's own terrace balcony. And the value for money was second to none. Wouldn't rave about the breakfast, but again it was served with a smile in their nice little courtyard. Other small negative was that our room was on the top floor (below the terrace). It was a bit noisy when one of our fellow guests decided they'd have a late night up there. Not a critisism of the hotel, but we provided a recommendation that they close the terrace after say 10pm Venice is pretty hard not to love but the Ca' dei Dogi made it that little bit more special.

Reviews.Title: “Even better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: Doc4
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Ca Dei Dogi, a small boutique hotel with six rooms. It was only a short walk from the boat stop (Alilaguna from the airport), literally around the corner from the Piazza San Marco. The people are delightful â€“ friendly and helpful. We were treated to a welcome drink, and could eat at the affiliated restaurant for 10% off. We purchased the breakfast option, and enjoyed the "made-to-order" omelets on the terrace each morning. The coffee (as it is in Italy) was strong, and refilled a number of times. Free Wi-Fi is available in the office (on their computer), or on one's laptop in the office or on the breakfast terrace. Our room (#401) was small, but had a wonderful sitting area (almost doubling its size) with stained-glass windows. We had our own balcony, as well as use of the roof-top terrace. The hotel, while in a old building, is very modern and scrupulously clean. All of the appliances and bathroom fixtures are quite high tech. San Marco is about a 5 minute walk, and shops, restaurants, and the Grand Canal are closer. At the far end of the alley on which the hotel is located (less than a minute) one can see the back of the Doge's Palace and the Bridge of Sighs (or one could if they weren't draped in scaffolding and tarps for renovation work). While there is a huge amount of "bustle" nearby, the immediate area around the hotel and restaurant is quiet. The area seemed very safe, and the hotel is conscious about security. We definitely would give our strongest recommendation to those looking for a fairly priced hotel near to all the action, but one that also gives needed respite from the tourist crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further!”
Reviews.Author: newyork62
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ca' dei Dogi for 3 nights in June. This a fabulous place with very convenient location and reasonable room rates. Rooms are small but absolutely beautifully decorated and very efficient. Bathrooms are very elegant. There is a cozy feel everywhere in the building. The entire place is sprakling clean. The breakfast is delicious and served either outside in the patio or in the breakfast area of the restaurant on the ground level. Susanna and Stefano are great hosts and graciously offer help and recommendations for anything you need. The hotel is hidden in an alley just 2 min walk from San Zaccaria vaporetto stop, and although it is right behind the Palazzo dei Dogi and Piazza San Marco, is very quiet and away from tourist traffic. We loved Ca' dei Dogi and will definitely return soon! Tip: Try the wine bars and outdoor restaurants around Campo San Giacomo - Al Prosecco and Muro are fun and very popular. The restaurants with outdoor sitting face Canale Grande and are strategic spots to watch the Canale and the gondolas and the buildings across in the evening. Need reservation for dinner, gets really busy around 7pm.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Ultimick
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel and so well located literally in the backyard of St Marks Square/Doges Palace. The hotel was easy to get too with excellent instructions on the website :0) On arrival we got a friendly greeting and a refreshing drink! The service could not have been better and the room although compact was well designed and beautiful. The jacuzzi bath was so relaxing. The little balcony was also very nice. The breakfast was lovely and plentifull to ensure you started the day full up! We also got a little suprise of a bottle of wine chilling in our bedroom. The restaurant next door was nice and good value I would definately recommend the profiteroles.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Venice!! Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: tonymegs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a few nights starting on May 23rd. Susanna and her staff were incredibly wonderful and so helpful. Stephen was excellent and both did everything to make our stay the best stay possible! The hotel was great..it was very clean and the balcony off our room was adorable and quaint! We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to our honeymoon...”
Reviews.Author: fairmountpa
Reviews.Content: When my husband and I arrived after a long journey, we were warmly welcomed by Stephano with a refreshing drink, warm words and excellent recommendations on where to eat. We were equally impressed by our beautiful room and roof-top balcony. In addition, Suzanna was so helpful in finding our lost baggage from the airline. She must have spent two hours on the phone locating it and before we knew it, our luggage was sitting in our room. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Jason76London
Reviews.Content: Boutique hotel just behind St Mark's square but quiet enough not to hear the noise. The rooms are cosy but the space is used thoughtfully and the bathrooms modern and clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Italy doesn't always have the best reputation when it comes to hotels but this one definitely isn't classed among them. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “St Mark's Square Location!”
Reviews.Author: EUEx-pat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Caâ€™ dei Dogi for 4 nights in October 2008 to celebrate my birthday. This was our (my boyfriend and I) first time to Venice. We booked in advance (Feb 2008) and at this time the hotel was ranked #1 on TA. Transportation We arrived in Venice at Treviso Airport with Ryan Air. We took the coach bus (associated with Ryan Air arrival times) to Venice Piazzale Roma â€“ ATVO Eurobus. From the bus station in Venice we took the water bus (1, 2, 52) and got off at San Zaccaria. San Zaccaria is very close to the hotel â€“ 1 minute walk and you are there. Neighborhood The area around the hotel is very quiet and it is tucked away from the craziness of St Markâ€™s Square. The hotel is very convenient to see St Marks Square and you can get to other areas with the water bus or by walking. We walked our entire stay because the weather was comfortable in October and we wanted to get lost in this cityâ€¦plus you see so much more! Room (photos included) We had the smallest double room on the ground floor for a rate of â‚¬160 per night (including breakfast). We booked the hotel through their website. The room was small with twin beds. It was equipped with the flat screen TV, desk area, safe and wardrobe area. The windows for this room were very high up as the ceiling to the room was very highâ€¦so there was no natural light. However, with the size and lack of natural light I still found this room to be cozy, clean and perfect for our stay. There were no cheap furnishings and that goes a long way. I would stay in this hotel and the same room again! Bathroom (photos included) The bathroom was also small but modern. The shower was a shower/tub combination and very clean. Amenities/Service We ate breakfast every morning at the hotelâ€¦very good. Eggs, bread, coffeeâ€¦were fantastic. Also the owner did reserve restaurants for us of our choice. The two owners were very friendly and helpful. They made the stay very pleasant for us. They do have laptop in the reception area to check your email â€“ which was convenient. Overall I would stay here again on a return visit to Venice. The service and room were wonderful and you canâ€™t beat the location or the price!

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment in a great location”
Reviews.Author: UKtraveller33
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the apartment, so cannot speak for the rest of the hotel. First let's mention the stairs. The apartment is on the sixth floor, with no lift, so it's 78 steps up to the room and 78 steps down. If you are not fairly fit, then this place is not for you. But if you are ........ then you come out into a light and airy apartment which is up above most of the surrounding buildings. The view is not spectacular, mainly rooftops, but it does mean you are not looking out onto a narrow alleyway, which is what most rooms in Venice do. Instead you have plenty of fresh air. We were there in May when the weather was quite warm, and did not need the air con on - the breeze through the windows was sufficient to keep the apartment pleasantly cool. The apartment is very spacious. There is a kitchen / diner / lounge, not luxurious but quite comfortable and large, with a small private balcony which is very nice to retreat to in the middle of the day when Venice is full of trippers. There is a small modern bathroom (shower, no bath), a smallish bedroom with masses of storage space, all connected by a spacious hall (where you can store luggage etc). Breakfast is in the hotel, which is just across the alleyway. Quite good for a continental breakfast. You could though consider making your own in the kitchen of the flat if you wished. Location is very good, just behind the Doge's Palace, so two minutes walk from Saint Mark's Square and 100 metres from the vaporetto stop. Some people have commented on the price of the flat. It's not cheap, but nothing is in Venice. It looked pretty good value to me, for the location, the space and overall facilities.

Reviews.Title: “A great find, excellent location and value.”
Reviews.Author: mrjPerth
Reviews.Content: We found this on Trip Advisor and it is certainly the Bargain of the Year. What a great location, next to the Bridge of Sighs and the San Marco Piazza, but very quiet inside. We had an economy room and our travelling companion had a single room. Both were very well appointed, comfortable and very clean. The roof top terrace was lovely. Our breakfast was very generous. Susannah, Steven and other staff were very friendly and helpful. Good priced restaurant attached to the Hotel and also opposite. Close to the Water bus stop so not too much walking with the luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Venice is a dream.In Ca' Dei Dogi the dream comes true.”
Reviews.Author: GSEB
Reviews.Content: we have been in CÃ  dei Dogi last week. very nice hotel, great location and friendly and helpful staff. Stefano and Susanna they can help you for restaurants and all what you need... we had a wonderful time drinking red wine on the roof top. Rooms are clean and romantic and the breakfast was very nice..with cheese omelette, eggs and bacon..yogurt..croissants..fruit salad..bread and a special capuccino! Sure we will come back again the next time we will visit Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location However Apartment Overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: bjinblue
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Sole Apartment which was located in a separate building to the Hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful, however i feel that the apartment was over priced. We could not get internet due to being in a different building and had to walk up and down six flights of stairs as there was no lift. There was no daily cleaning of the apartment and the kitchen in the apartment did not contain adequate cooking utensils for a simple meal such as pasta. The roof top terrace was great though. iIwould not recommend the apartment but a stay in a Hotel room may be better.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Mixmaster300
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ca' dei Dogi in the jacuzzi room and loved everything about this hotel from the location to the wonderful staff. When you walk out of the hotel down two alleys you are right in the heart of activity but because the hotel is tucked away, it is very quiet. There is a resturant that is attached which is owned by the hotel owner and the food is excellent. Guests of the hotel are given 10% off and are treated to champaign and lemonchello with their meal. The hotel has wifi and if you do not have your own laptop, you can use theirs no charge. We had a 6:00am flight out of Venice so the staff arranged for a water taxi to pick us up and made sure we got to the taxi stand and off to the airport. You are a 5 minute walk from San Marco square, very good location. The hotel is very clean. If we ever go back, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous honeymoon stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: amalfi_lvr
Reviews.Content: We have to preface by saying we had the jacuzzi room, which may be a little roomier than some of the other rooms. The room was cozy and had everything we needed. It did take a couple of tries to figure out how to use the jacuzzi, but then it worked fine. We loved the location. It was centrally located, right next to the Doge's Palace and St. Mark's. The hosts Stefano and Susana were delightful. They were very helpful in giving advice; anything from where to catch the gondolas to where to find a pharmacy that was open late. We would love to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful service, but not good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: lindashirer
Reviews.Content: We had high hopes for this hotel, based upon TripAdvisor reviews, but were disappointed in the value for money. The staff were extremely helpful and courteous and this is certainly worth quite a bit, but the rooms are very small, much too small for the amount of money we paid. That being said, the bathrooms are very good and the amenities are high tech and excellent. The bed was too hard for us, and we had to walk up three full flights to our room, so be aware that for handicapped or elderly travelers, this hotel is not suitable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: babyili
Reviews.Content: When visiting a city as unique as Venice, location is everything! As an overall experience the hotel was great but I would like to list the pros and cons. Pros: 1.Location. 2. Great staff. Thumbs up for Stefano and Suzanna at the reception. Polite and efficient. Really got out of their way to make Gondola and dinner reservations for us and they were all great!! 3. Free Internet and WiFi. 4. Modern decoration and friendly atmosphere. 5. Sat TV in all the rooms. 6. Reasonable prices without surprises. Cons: 1. Rooms not thouroughly clean. 2. One needs a Phd to make the shower work. 3. Horrible breakfast. Despite the aforementioned cons, it is a lovely hotel with lovely people.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: superjames
Reviews.Content: Location is good and breakfast was nice. Some of the reviews really over rate this hotel. Rooms were very nice, clean .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: beachiebum
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. We spent 2 nights in the jacuzzi room and although the room itself was a bit small the cleanliness and decor were wonderful. We especially enjoyed the large bathroom. The people at the front desk were very warm and friendly and happily made us reservations for dinner and gave us directions. We felt the location was ideal and it was not too hard to find. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Again, splendid”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaBlues
Reviews.Content: Just back from another delightful visit in Venice. Some things do not change: Stefano, Susanna, et al. are very knowledgeable and extremely helpful (.e.g., dining, transport options, etc.). The small hotel is nicely appointed, tasteful, quiet, and in a great location. And now it is even more familiar!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and efficient”
Reviews.Author: AnonBear
Reviews.Content: If you are in Venice for just a few days, this is the perfect location. The hotel is relatively expensive, has incredibly small rooms and a breakfast offering that provides almost no choice and is served in a characterless room a small as a cloakroom! However, given its location I would still recommend it. Having not stayed elsewhere in Venice, I can't really compare it to other Venetian B&Bs, but, for example, Il Villino in Firenze offered much more charm, large and airy rooms, and a far better b'fast experience, for a comparable price. I guess this is what I was hoping for from Ca' d D and why we chose a B&B over a hotel, so I was understandably a little disappointed. Providing you temper your expectations, the fact that the service is hospitable and charming and the booking and check in is smooth and efficient, it will probably leave you with a very positive impression. It's also worth pointing out that although it's only maybe one minute's walk from the ferry stops and the Doges palace, the hotel is quietly tucked away. The best of both worlds. My travel tip would be to get a 48hr/72hr travel card from the ferry stop @ San Zaccaria and use it. It's the best value the city has to offer. With this you can float up and down the grand canal and visit all the islands via public transport, you can also get back to the airport using Vap #52 and then the #5 bus from Pi. Roma stop (although shelling out on a water taxi is well worth it for the trip in). Best lunchtime dining tip, take in a leisurely lunch in Dorsoduro, get off @ Academie and walk to the many good neighbourhood restaurants there overlooking the island of La Giudecca. Eating out in Venice (San Marco/Rialto area) is outrageously expensive and not all that good. Average food, compounded by the Â£/Euro exchange rate meant that we were very disappointed with the food/value in the restaurants we tried, even after careful online research. I'd say many of the recommendations are the best of a bad bunch, a shame when in other Italian cities the food can be fantastic! Much better to wander around back streets of residential neighbourhoods and grab what the locals are eating - tapas style. Just be prepared to be disappointed at dinner (especially on a Sunday, when anything decent seems to be shut). The one exception to our dining disappointment was Corte Sconta (also shut on Sunday), which we ate at on our first night. It was v expensive but v good and set a standard that the rest of the restaurants simply couldn't live up to.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely marvellous”
Reviews.Author: sonostrov
Reviews.Content: We have staeyd at Ca Dei Dogi for 4 nights. We have used advice from trip advisor.com and the hotel exceeded our expectations. Many thanks to wonderful hosts Stefano and Susanna ans the rest of friendly staff. Everything was perfect. Great advice including restaurants, attractions. Everything is immaculate. Breakfast is very good. One cannot come closer to Doge,s palace. We would definitely recommend this hotel and we dream of coming back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: goldcoasting
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Venice and I wanted it to be special. I found Ca' dei Dogi on Tripadvisor.com and was sure that this was the place I wanted to stay. Upon arriving, I knew I had been right. Susana and Stefano made our brief stay in Venice extremely comfortable. The Ca' dei Dogi is incredibly clean, quiet and so well situated, we couldn't believe we were nearly next to the Doge's Palace itself. The breakfast was very ample and delicious. The room itself had all the amenities a traveller could ask for, and while the weather did not allow us to use the little terrace off the Jacuzzi Room, I can see that it would be delightful in fine weather. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to have a special experience in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Unique apartment in best Venice location.”
Reviews.Author: junevolante
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days in Venice in the apartment owned by the hotel, located less than 5 minutes from Piazza San Marco. Superb modern design with good space and light including full kitchen and option of extra double bed in lounge area. Unique sunny rooftop terrace to enjoy morning coffee or evening sundowners! Breakfast included with hotel guests with friendly service and plenty of help with ideas for restaurants and transport options. Use Allilaguna waterbus direct airport transport if you need to save time. Recommended for all except those unable to climb stairs as it is on 6th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location & People”
Reviews.Author: Jabei
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a quiet, clean hotel near the centre of Venice, I can't think there are many better than this. Easy to find if you follow the website directions.....less than 5 minutes from the water taxi and also from the main square. The people are very friendly and the rooms are incredibly clean and well appointed (if very small!). We had a small balcony which would be very nice in Summer...less so in January. No bath, just a shower...but that's ok. Breakfast is in a small room and is a basic continental meal. It's not particularly cheap but then again, nor is Venice in general. I would definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Very, very good”
Reviews.Author: PAUL250268
Reviews.Content: My title says it all. We stayed in room 401 which has a sitting area and small terrace. All of the staff were super friendly and nother was ever too much trouble. Breakfast was delicious. If you are going to Venice this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: travelling_man_11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here at the end of Nov and beginning of Dec 2008 for 2 nights. This was one of the cleanest hotels we have stayed in. The owner Stefano is so kind and his entire staff are extremely customer oriented and hospitable. We stayed in the apartment across the street on the (7th floor) in Italy they call it the 6th as the first floor is called (zero floor). Anyhow, the apartment was georgeous and super clean. This aparment was fully furnished with an entire kitchen including stove and oven. There was a futon in the kitchen and family room area with flat screen tv and interation sattelite tv. There was also a very good sized terrace with a great view of Venice. The bedroom is a very good size with also another flat screen tv. The place has wooden floors and super modern design. Be advised that most of the other rooms tend to be smaller but for a family of 4 this would be terrific to stay in. It was a very large size even for American standards. Also, breakfast is included and they even give you a delicious omelette, coffee, fruit, cookies, and croissants. It was one of the better breakfast included hotels we stayed at during Italy. It also conveniently located to the San Zaccharia boatstop and a block from San Marcos and the Doges Palace. You would be a fool not to stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location excellent; rooms very small.”
Reviews.Author: GabeGal
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this hotel definitely is in a fantastic location, even though approaching it via two very tiny and ancient alleyways is a little offputting initially! The staff were friendly and there was a computer for the free use of guests which was helpful. Unfortunately, the restaurant was closed (end of season as this was mid-November). The one ground floor room (101) is a twin bedded room, frequently referred to in other reviews. It is indeed very small and only has windows at a high level so you cannot see outside. Any more than one suitcase would be very difficult to deal with. Our other room rented was on the 3rd floor, up a very narrow stone staircase. It was 301, the single. Again, the room was very small indeed but did have a window onto the alleyway entrance. The bathroom was pretty new but small and anyone tall sitting on the toilet would have to sit sideways! I cannot recommend the hotel for people with disabilities or, at least for the two rooms seen, for families with children. It is a great place for its location but don't expect North American spaces!

Reviews.Title: “Small but Perfectly Formed Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MacMil
Reviews.Content: My mum and I stayed here at the beginning of October for 4 nights and had a lovely time. The saying goes that location is everything and you can certainly say this is true of Ca' dei Dogi. The hotel is just 2 minutes walk from San Marco which couldn't be better. Nearby is a waterbus stop from which you can hop on and explore Venice and other islands such as Murano. It is also very convenient if you arrive at Marc O'Polo airport as the waterbus service from the airport drops you just a few minutes walk from the hotel. We stayed in rooms 202 and 302, a single and a double and paid 100Euros and 160Euros respectively. Which I think for mid-season and location is a good price. The rooms are on the small side but beautifully furnished and very clean. The bathrooms especially are lovely. There is a small roof terrace available for all the guests too. Breakfast was fine with pastries, orange juice, omelete, yoghurt, coffee etc. A couple of tips; get up early before breakfast and go to San Marco before the crowds appear - it is magical. And if you have time go to Murano island which has dozens of shops selling some of the best Murano glass you will find. Overall a very enjoyable holiday in Venice in no small part due to staying in this excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Botique Hotel in the heart of Venice”
Reviews.Author: guruyowie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ca'dei Dogi 10/31 through to 11/3 and absolutely loved it. The hotel is very close to St. Marks square but is situated down a quiet alley, so there was no noise at night. The rooms are very nicely appointed and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The included continental breakfast was also very good. It consisted of fruit salad, croissants, yogurt, omelets and coffee. I find it really makes a difference having a decent breakfast at the hotel before heading out for the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Ca' dei Dogi in Venice”
Reviews.Author: renboarkansas
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to Italy where we stayed at the Ca' dei Dogi in Venice for two nights. It was a great location, close to the Piazza San Marco, very clean, and the staff was extremely helpful. We stayed in the economy room which was very small, designed a bit like a room in a cruise ship, yet comfortable, and again and most importantly, clean. Venice was fairly crowded so it was really nice to have the use of the roof-top patio where we had wine and cheese in the evening and could just relax and enjoy the quiet. The continental breakfast (including omelets) was very good. We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: angiro
Reviews.Content: Having read rave reviews on Trip Advisor we though disappointment was inevitable, but fortunately we were wrong. A couple of minutes walk from the San Zaccaria waterbus stop on the busy Riva Schiavoni and just round the corner from San Marco, but very quiet (except for the occasional song from a gondolier entertaining his passengers, there's a canal nearby). We arrived early expecting to ditch our bags in the lobby and go out, but we were welcomed with a glass of Prosecco and shown to our rooms soon after. The level of service is exceptional; nothing was too much trouble. Stefano and Susanna recommended restaurants, reserved tables and made a concert booking for us; in the breakfast room we were given helpings of a delicious chocolatey tiramisu as an unasked for bonus! We stayed in Room 101, which a recent occupant was not very happy with. It is small, but with a high ceiling. We thought the hotel had made a good use of the available space by putting the twin beds up on a higher level (just a few steps) and creating storage space underneath, which was quite adequate for our bags, plus a wardrobe. The bathroom was no smaller than many we have had, and there was a rail on the wall to which the shower head could be attached, so a 'stand up' shower was possible. Our only criticism would be that the windows are small and too high up on the wall to look out, although this isn't a huge problem when you aren't spending much time in there. From this point of view we felt our friends in the first floor double economy room (201?) were better off. However, we were invited to use the roof terrace, which was super. Overall we loved it, have already recommended it to friends and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel / Very Small Double Room”
Reviews.Author: Chablis28
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel for the staff's warm attitude and enthusiam. They couldn't have tried harder to please us and be of service. We also found the room to be nicely appointed and immaculate. That said, our first floor economy double(Room 101) just off the reception desk was much smaller still than I expected and frankly an uncomfortable fit for two people in my opinion. The hotel offered several times, to upgrade us the last night of our 3 night stay at the same price as a superior room but we just didn't feel like repacking for one night. It should be noted that my wife and I only had 2 small Rick Steves style backpacks(one for each of us), so I don't know what most people schlepping everything but the kitchen sink do when they get this room??? This room comes with a tiny and I mean tiny bathroom. The shower head is on a cable like most Euro hotels but is attached to the tub so you have to hand hold it the whole time if you choose to stand up rather than take a bath. We never take baths in hotels so this was a real inconvenience for my wife and I. This room was barely bigger than our adult son's single room 302 which we were envious of. His single room felt a lot more spacious than our economy double and was cheaper than our room. His single also had a stand up shower stall. My wife joked about going up to use Joe's shower everyday. All of that said, this hotel was terriffic on many other levels like service, attitude, cleanliness and location. Our room even though on the first floor was extremely quiet and came with a double door to insure quietness. I would strongly recommend that you not book here if this room is your option unless you don't mind a very tight space. I told the hotel that in my opinion this should be the cheapest room in the hotel and sell for the same price as a single due to its small size and the lack of a stand up shower. That said, we would love to come back here and stay in one of their larger rooms on a higher floor. Stefon and Sussan are great hosts and we would stay there again, just not room 101.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: MontyGr
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in the Ca' dei dogi in September 2008 and only wish we could have stayed for longer. The hotel is situated behind St Marks Square - so close that we could see the back of the Ducale Palace from our room - but as previous reviewers have said, its incredibly peaceful and quiet. We stayed in the jacuzzi room. Although not huge, the room was a good size. The jacuzzi was a great touch, the only downside being that the shower was handheld and not very practical. We also had a lovely little terrace overlooking a garden, which we would have used more if it hadn't been for the rain. The rooms are very tastefully decorated. The easiest way to get to the hotel is to take a waterbus to the San Zaccheria stop. From there the hotel is approximately a 5 minute walk (if that). The owners and all of the staff are very friendly and helpful, offering advice and information. Breakfast is continental style and the choice is somewhat limited, but still very nice. Overall the Ca' dei dogi is friendly, charming, well-located hotel and we will definitely stay there the next time that we visit this amazing city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service--but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoLouise
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in mid-September. Followed the directions off the hotel's website and had no trouble finding this charming little inn, just steps from the vaporetto stop. For being as close as it is to St. Mark's, the room was quiet as could be! Service was lovely, free internet, breakfast was great--they even opened early so we could eat before heading to the airport for an early flight! Beware, however, that the room is very small...luckily we travel light, as I'm not sure there would have been room for two medium size suitcases! If you're at all uncomfortable in small spaces, perhaps this is not the best place for you to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location”
Reviews.Author: Claire_murray
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location to explore Venice. Whilst its so close you're practically in St Marks square, its also so quiet you'd believe you were miles away. The hotel is hidden behind the Doge's palace in a small alley. Its close to the waterbus stops and due to this enables you to travel throughout Venice without any problems. The rooms are clean and modern. We stayed in the economy twin room which I wouldn't recommend as its small and quite dark. However I haven't let that influence this review other than the recommend that you take a different room. The staff were friendly and helpful. THey were prepared to give advice and went out of their way to assist us. Breakfast was lovely. I would stay here again without any reservations in doing so.

Reviews.Title: “What A Gem!!”
Reviews.Author: Diamondlover
Reviews.Content: I am just back from an unbelievably fantastic "50th Birthday European Adventure" (if you have to turn 50, turn 50 in style). This little gem of a hotel was our first stop on a 16 night whirlwind tour of Venice, Rome, Positano, Bellagio, Innsbruck, Kitzbuhel, Salzburg and Vienna. What a fabulous location, steps from the vaporetto and St. Marks, there were 6 of us on this leg of the trip, and we all fell in love with Ca' Dei Dogi AND the lovely Susanna (and Stefano and everyone else associated). Just as with a previous reviewer, Susanna had to come to our rescue when we had the wrong train station for the day of our departure (beware....Venezia Maestre is NOT the train station in the heart of the town...). Susanna also steered us toward excellent restaurants, we were not let down. If you are reading this review, Susanna, thank you from Charlene & gang...we appreciate everything you did. Our rooms were comfortable, attractive and spotless. Our (adult) son and daughter had the main floor twin bed room - it was outfitted similar to a cabin on a sailboat, and was very cozy and interestingly laid out, they loved it. My husband and I had the Jacuzzi suite with a small balcony on the 3rd floor - perfect. My best friend and her daughter occupied a superior suite on the top floor, which had a separate twin bed..again, perfect for our needs. There's also a terrace where everyone could gather for a drink. The breakfast served was so lovely, jam filled fresh, warm croissants (never had any as good again the rest of the trip), rolls, fruit, yogurt, juices..and they'll make an omelette for you as well. It was perfect. I couldn't recommend this charming hotel enough...the price is fantastic for Venezia, the location can't be beat, the staff are wonderful. You can keep your large 5 star hotels, give me the personal attention, warmth and charm of a small hotel like this any day. If I'm ever back in Venezia, I won't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Personal”
Reviews.Author: world1976
Reviews.Content: This is a gem in Venice! Fantastic location, just off from St. Mark's Square, and steps from the Grand Canal. Makes for easy walking from the vaporetto to the hotel. Get off at the second St. Mark's "water taxi" stop. They have made great use of the small spaces. Everything is efficient and well planned out. Our college age girls liked that they could check email in the lobby for free.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: slot14
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Ca dei Dogi. One aspect that cannot be underestimated is its location right by San Marco Square and also just steps from the Vaporetto stop. This made coming and going extremely easy. Our hosts greeted us personally and it is obvious that they care about their customers. The room was modern and very clean. We also enjoyed the breakfast in a nice dining room and again personal service. Venice can be just swamped with tourists and we only had to go a few steps to escape the madness.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: manase
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this hotel and it provided a very comfortable base to explore this magical city from. Our stay started with huge apologies that our room was not ready when it was actually us who had arrived 15 minutes early! As we had mentioned that it was our honeymoon, we were upgraded for no extra cost to a jacuzzi room, which was a lovely treat. The owners and staff made us feel right at home from the minute we walked in the door. Our room was gorgeous, the breakfasts delicious and the location absolutely fantastic. We especially enjoyed relaxing on our own little balcony. Overall this is highly recommendable and we would love to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Ca' dei Dogi has the wow factor.”
Reviews.Author: Cheekypups
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I were winding up a three week holiday in Europe. The first couple of weeks were a hectic family reunion and the Ca' Dei Dogi provided the perfect unwind before returning home to Australia. Stefano and Suzanna were the perfect hosts and made us feel like we had arrived home as we stepped through the door. This hotel had the wow factor at every turn, from the spotless rooms to the modern bathrooms and located a stones throw from San Marco Square. We could nor fault it. The adjoining Taverna's seafood was magnificent and the staff very were friendly and welcoming. The mornings started with an inclusive breakfast of fresh fruit, croissants, toast, omelettes, juice and tea or coffee. Early afternoons were spent relaxing on the roof top terrace with nibbles and a glass or two of lambrusco followed by riposo (Italian siesta) in our air conditioned room. Ca' Dei Dogi is ideally located close to all the main attractions and so only a short stroll home each evening. The rates are very competitive for Venice and so did not break the budget. We cant wait to visit again... maybe on our honeymoon. David and Nichole, Canberra, Australia.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Find!”
Reviews.Author: ctgal2008
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here 2 nights. After a car ride from Bellagio, a train ride from Milan, and a very crowded vapporetto ride, Stephano's warm and welcoming smile melted away any weary traveler feelings we may have had. Susanna was just as lovely. The location is perfect...about a block from Piazza San Marco but somehow quiet and private. Very moderately priced. It's also by the Castello region of Venice, which is a little less crowded and worth a stroll if you'd like to step off the beaten path. Another plus, Ca' dei Doge is a very short walk to a vapporetto stop. My husband and I stayed in their apt across the street, on the 6th floor, but they carry your luggage up and down for you since there are no elevators. Modern and clean decor. Very roomy for 2. We enjoyed our roof top balcony which had a view of the rear of the Doges Palace and the surrounding roofs. Breakfast was very satisfying. All and all we'd return to Ca' dei Doge in a second!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, beautiful hotel, superb service!”
Reviews.Author: turnersc
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon. The young man at the front desk, Rizza (?), was so helpful and brought us Spumante on check in becuase it was our honeymoon. Breakfast was pretty standard. The attached restaurant was very nice. We ate there and the seafood dishes are highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A REAL hidden Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Chirgs
Reviews.Content: If you are planning to stay in Venice, THIS is the place to stay! I must admit I have mixed feelings about writing a review as I would like to keep this hotel a 'hidden secret', but feel obliged to other travellers to reveal this hidden gem, as it was through the TripAdvisor reviews that I booked this hotel in the first place! Travelling with an 18 month old we booked the 'Sole' Apartment, across the laneway from the hotel. Located on the 6th floor (no lift) it is a beautiful, light filled 1 bedroom apartment with all amentities and a lovely terrace. The location of the hotel is fantastic, around the corner from St Mark's and walking distance to all the sites. The staff were always smiling and helpful. A very big thank you to Susanna who was fantastic with our 18 month old and could not do enough to help us during our stay. We loved the Hotel and will definately be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hotel”
Reviews.Author: csuosu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in June, 2008. They have a few rooms in the main hotel and a few in the building across the alley. We stayed in the suite on the top floor of the building across the alley. The room was fabulous. It was extremely clean and quite large. The bathroom was spotless. The suite had a separate kitchen area that was very large. The only downside was that the room was on the sixth floor and there is no elevator. However, the staff of the hotel took care of all of our luggage, so the stairs were never a problem. In addition to the room being so great, the hotel is right behind the Doge's Palace and about 100 yards from the boat docks at St. Mark's Square. I can't imagine a better hotel in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “New Favorite”
Reviews.Author: TRAVEL4EDUCATION
Reviews.Content: Upon our return, we have told all of our friends about this hidden gem. It is a great value in an expensive city and is in a fantastic location - on the opposite side of the Bridge of Sighs from the Doge's Palace, convenient to the water taxis. The interior design of the rooms were elegant with all modern conveniences, and the rooftop patio was a wonderful respite from the crowds. The front desk staff was amazingly helpful even finding my husband a place to watch the Formula One Grand Prix. The breakfast was substantial, and everyone in the hotel appeared to be enjoying themselves. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic appartment”
Reviews.Author: Aussieescape
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is in a great location just around the corner from St,Marco Square. It allows you easy walking distance to all the sights / shops and is located in a quite side street to escape the crowds. We booked the appartment "Sole" and was not disappointed with it, very moden, clean with picturesque veiws from it,s terrace. The best accommodation on our trip.Owners and staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel close to San Marco”
Reviews.Author: Sheba_8
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Caâ€™ dei Dogi in Venice during our May 2008 visit to Italy. It is a sophisticated, clean, well-maintained hotel conveniently located within easy walking distance to the Piazza San Marco. We stayed in the top floor double room that was peaceful and quiet. Our room was bright, airy, and tastefully decorated with an elegant, well appointed bathroom. The room has its own separate sitting area and a small private deck. Every aspect was top quality. The staff provided warm, friendly, and helpful hospitality, speaking fluent English.

Reviews.Title: “Slice of Heaven in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ricksriot
Reviews.Content: Originally booked 2 nights but there was an error with the system and only 1 took . This was caught only days before our arrival. Stefano, the owner, was completely apologetic and had secured another hotel he knew well, around the corner, at the same price. He even promised to move our luggage for us (huge help when you realize how hard it it to lug heavy suitcases up 6 flights of very narrow stairs)! When we arrived he had a bottle of sparkling wine for us. Everything worked out fine....but we would have preferred spending both nights in Ca' dei Dogi as the accommodations were a big step above everything else. Modern, tasteful decor. Clever use of space. A real queen/king bed (not 2 twins pushed together). A bed with some cushion to it......anyone else notice that Italian hotels have the hardest beds in Europe? The bathrooms are clean, modern, and a shower that I would love to have in my own home. Breakfast was very good, cooked omelette to order in addition if you request at no charge. Plus, an actual computer with free internet access to guests. Stefano was the nicest and most hospitable proprietor you could ask for. Would definitely stay here again and heartily recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the action”
Reviews.Author: TheDom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the double room with jacuzzi. The hotel is very close to the vaporetto stop San Zaccaria. We missed the turn into the court the first time but quickly discovered our mistake. The private balcony was cozy and you could see the doge's palace roof. The bed was firm but many beds in Europe are. There was ample room and everything was spotless. The hotel staff were incredibly helpful. They helped us figure out the airport taxi system, which saved us a lot of money since our plane left at 6:55am. Breakfast is served from 6:30 to 10:15 am and consisted of croissant, yogurt, fresh fruit, and an omelette if you desire. They offer coffee and espresso of course. The only complaints we had were there were ants in our room from the terrace and there was some noise that came through from the private apartment above us. They came in late and we could hear them walking around. The other complaint was from the attached restaurant, Taverna Dei Dogi. Hotel guests do get a discount (make sure you tell them before you eat). However, the food is mediocre compared to what you can get for similar prices down the street and service is chaotic. Overall, it is a nice hotel with personal service that is as close to piazza san marco as you can get.

Reviews.Title: “1st class in Venice”
Reviews.Author: towsonnc
Reviews.Content: Quite simply, book this hotel without any hesitation at all if they open availability for your dates. I stayed at Ca dei Dogi for two nights in late May. We had the jacuzzi room and our friends had the double room with small terrace. Both were very nice and I would recommend either if you have the chance to stay at this hotel. I could not have imagined a better experience and all the positive characteristics previously noted on tripadvisor are 100% accurate. Here are a few reasons why this hotel should be considered in the top tier in Venice: 1. Service - As previously noted, Stefano and Susanna are the perfect hosts. They will arrange almost anything for you whether its dinner reservations, vaporetto schedules, tours, etc. They genuinely care about your experience and it absolutely shows through during the stay. 2. Location - Centrally situated only minutes from St Marks and about 5-10 min walk from the Rialto Bridge. It's quiet down a small alley but yet right in the heart of where you want to be. Don't be fooled by people who suggest staying near the train station. 3. Value - the price in my opinion is fairly low and could realistically be 20%-30% higher. i wouldnt be surprised to see prices go higher since they're always booked but even if they were ~300 euro/night, I'd stay there without hesitation. Comparable options both in price and quality are not easy to come by. 4. Rooms - the two rooms I saw were very nicely appointed with a modern flare. keep in mind, US standards are different so the beds will be more firm, rooms will be somewhat small, and pillows will be flattish. that being said, they still exceeded our expectations significantly. as i said at the beginning, book this hotel without any hesitation at all if you have the opportunity. this hotel is the definition of why tripadvisor is a successful website today (people want to find relatively unknown but yet great places to stay) - ca' dei dogi is a gem in a city filled with many run down, tourist trap type hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Perfetto!”
Reviews.Author: SaraSuffolk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in the Double Economy room. Based on the reviews and the â€œeconomyâ€� classification, we expected the room to be a bit on the small side so we were not surprised or disappointed. The room has a double bed (queen sized, I think) which is pushed into the corner of the room. There is an L-shaped walkway around the bed to get to the bathroom. The room is beautifully decorated, as is the rest of the hotel, and was perfect for us. We donâ€™t need a huge room as we prefer to spend most of our time sightseeing. However, had we planned to stay for several days, we may have considered reserving a larger room in the hotel. The location cannot be beat, being next door to the Dogeâ€™s Palace, a few minutes walk to St. Markâ€™s, and near a major water taxi (vaporetto) stop. The hotel has a beautiful rooftop patio with several chairs and a table with an umbrella. It is surrounded with beautiful plants and flowers, with views of the Dogeâ€™s Palace, and was the perfect place for relaxing. At night, we enjoyed a glass of wine while listening to the live music being played at St. Markâ€™s square. It was magical and, we thought, a much better option than fighting the crowds and overpriced establishments on the square. As an American, good deals and values are hard to find in Italy, with the dollar being so weak. However, I rate this hotel a 5 in terms of value because I did A LOT of research prior to making reservations and am convinced I would not find a nicer place in an equally wonderful location for the same or better price. Stefano and Susanna were wonderful hosts, eager to make sure we had directions, maps, reservations, etc. They were very attentive to our needs and were always quick to make suggestions to enhance our stay. We loved this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “A Room With A View”
Reviews.Author: poetphotographer
Reviews.Content: Would you like a room with a view? I stayed in the Apartment Sole for a week in early May and just loved it. What a beautiful, clean space--a contemporary design with an old world feel, wonderful light, exposed timber beams, and a sunny balcony. The aesthetics are fantastic and, on a practical level, the spacious apartment has all the amenities-- I could also offset some of the expense of Venice by making use of the kitchen. The six flights of stairs were not difficult and the staff will help with luggage. Stefano and Suzanna offer a great deal of personal warmth in the way they manage Ca' dei Dogi and I am grateful to them for their hospitality and generousity. They were attentive to whatever I may have needed to make my stay comfortable. They also helped me navigate the vaporetto system for trips to Murano, Burano, and the train station. They were so accomodating, I felt that I could ask them anything. Breakfast was excellent with omelettes if you like and a rave review for the capuccinos. The service was excellent. I also appreciated the restaurant, especially upon arrival after a very long travel day. The location, just around the corner from the bustling St. Mark's square, offers a kind of oasis of quiet and privacy. I loved the views from the apartment of the Doge Palace, St. Mark's bell tower, the cupolas of the basilica, Castello's skyline, the charm of tiled rooftops. There is also a glimpse of the lagoon from the balcony. Ca' dei Dogi is a special place to stay in the heart of a special city. I would go back. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our visit very much-it was a great location and the owner”
Reviews.Author: TACapeCod
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days at this marvelous little hotel in a wonderful area of Venice-we loved the location-a neighborhood of "real Venice"-families, local restaurants, etc. The hotel is in a great location-near all of the major sights. We would highly recommend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Divinely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ElleSheri
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a lot of hotels in my lifetime but nothing makes me feel more at home than that of this spectacular hotel.. This is boutique hotel at it's finest... beautiful decor... no details were spared... the tiles were speckled with gold, absolutely stunning. The best part of my stay are the amazing hosts! It is true what everyone said in their reviews, Stefano and Suzanna are genuine hosts....Their service was so personalised, you don't feel that you are staying in a hotel. You actually feel that you are staying with genuine friends. They are truly warm and concern about your well being. I came to Venice staying in a hotel, but I end up knowing wonderful host who will end up being a good friend... If you are fed up of faceless, impersonalised treatment you get in major hotel chains, stay in this hotel.. It's all great Venetian goodness in one tiny package... 11 stars out of ten!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ItalyLadies
Reviews.Content: We were so amazed and delighted by the wonderful care and accommodations we had at this hotel. The five of us -- 85-year old mother, her three daughters, and 8 year old granddaughter -- stayed in 4 of the rooms for 4 nights, and we could not have been happier. We arrived at the train station & took the water bus to the San Zaccharia stop, then took a very short walk to the small alley way leading to the hotel. Susanna warmly greeted us and took over all the details of our checking in, while seating us outside on the patio with complimentary proseco (and a coke for our young traveler). The rooms were beautifully decorated -- and even my room (the small single room, 301, on the third floor) was very comfortable, with every convenience. The breakfasts were very good, with whatever coffee you asked for (I always had the scrumptious capuccino), blood orange juice and water, fruit salad, brioche, and omelettes to order (really delicious). Susanna was fabulous with suggestions and directions, and she even straightened out a problem I had with an online ticket agent, from whom I bought tickets in the U.S. for the secret tour of the Doges Palace. (And she knew exactly where to go for a less expensive, beautiful gondola ride, which was one of the highlights of our trip). All of the hotel staff were superb -- particularly the young man who helped us with our luggage and with breakfast, even at 4 am in the morning on our day of departure, when we had an early morning flight. We loved eating dinner at the hotel's Taverna dei Dogi one night -- let the waiter choose appetizers and the main course for you and relax and enjoy a fabulous seafood dinner. If you want to splurge another night, go to the nearby Hotel Metropole on the Grand Canal and order the "Surprise" tasting menu for 95 E each -- it made for a very special last night's dinner in Venice. Thank you Ca dei Dogi for our magical visit to Venice. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A JEWEL”
Reviews.Author: scrumdiddlyumptious
Reviews.Content: Suzanna and Stefano are wonderful! They have made a beautiful secret oasis of calm and kindness right in the heart of Venice. We were welcomed warmly and relieved of the burden of our luggage, shown to our gorgeous rooms...we had the jacuzzi room and our friends, the superior room with the amazing window. Everything about the room and the service was first class from start to finish. We've stayed in Venice many times but these were the most genuinely concerned hosts we've ever had. Highly recommended for all reasons. Stefano and Suzanna are gentle and caring and will do everything they can to make sure you eat at the best restaurants and get fair prices for taxis. Let them help you make some choices, you can trust them. We're definitely coming back. AFTER we'd paid our bill and left our luggage there, the heavens over Venice opened and we couldn't find a dry place in the whole city. They let us come back in and drip all over the tiny foyer and breakfast room til we had to go to the airport! A lot of places stop smiling once you've paid the bill, but this was different............. THANK YOU CA DEI DOGI!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A maze of twisty little passageways”
Reviews.Author: HunterDrayman
Reviews.Content: "You are in a maze of twisty little passageways, all alike", but fortunately help is at hand in the shape of Stefano and Suzanna, our excellent hosts at Hotel CÃ¡ de Dogi. Nothing seems to be too much trouble, and weâ€™ve had a very relaxing and enjoyable week. We rented their "Apartment Sole" (Sun Apartment) on the top floor of a small building just across the twisty passageway from the main hotel. Its quite a climb to the top (78 steps) but well worth it, comprising a modern well equipped living room/kitchen/diner, shower/bathroom, small cosy bedroom with a wide king-size bed and a terrace looking out over the rooftops and the Bridge of Sighs to the Dogi's Palace. As I type, the air conditioning refuses to go cold, but I'm sure its operator error and Stefano will be able to tell me what I'm doing wrong tomorrow after breakfast, which incidentally is most Venetian (coffee how-you-like-it and brioche) plus fruit salad, juice, and yoghurt. Omelette is on offer too. Anyway, for now, I just open some windows which are rather splendid powered velux affairs. Itâ€™s hard resisting the temptation to play. The kitchen has most things you need for home-made snacks and take-aways if you want to reduce your dining-out budget. In fact, I'd say its probably the cheapest way of staying in the heart of Venice for a week costing about the same as a hotel room per night but affording much greater comfort (as long as you don't mind the stairs). We've been able to have some meals in and some out. When itâ€™s very easy to spend â‚¬80 on a modest restaurant meal around here, the occasional take-away pizza helps balance the finances. Thereâ€™s a good but small supermarket a few streets away in San Lio and S&S can provide directions. The weather has been mixed this week (April 9-16, 2008) and we've been able to enjoy the sun terrace as well as dry-out the wet shoes, coats and trousers much more easily than in a hotel. Other reviews here have fully described the marvelous location so I won't go into that except to say that its quite magical being able to just pop out for ten minutes for a stroll around San Marco. What else can I add?: If you are going in the near future be aware that building work is happening next door at the same level. So Mon-Fri there has been constant noise of drills, saws and shouting. Having said that, we've not found it obtrusive as it is going on inside the building rather than on the scaffolding outside. In fact, it's provided some entertainment, especially when nobody could find Giovanni one day. Also, if you like long drinks of tea or coffee take your own mugs. Italians donâ€™t do long hot drinks its not part of the culture and Suzanna didnâ€™t have anything that would suffice in the restaurant either. We eventually tracked some down in a local hardware shop. Other recommendations: There's quite a bit of debate, I notice, as to whether a Venice Card is worth the â‚¬80 (orange variety). I'd say most definitely yes, especially now that single journey rate is â‚¬6.50 and the loos cost â‚¬1 per pee. Pre-book it on the web anyway and pay up front as well, if you trust the rather idiosyncratic ACTV web site. I read a review that stated restaurant owners in the vicinity of San Marco view their clientele as â€˜one-shotâ€™ prey and consequently there is no need for them to provide value for money. Sadly it seems to be true, at least, in our experience this week. Iâ€™d single some out but it seems unfair. Basically take what youâ€™d pay in UK pounds for any item (even coffee) double it and thatâ€™s what youâ€™ll pay in Euros in the San Marco area. But head away from that area and you will eventually get value for money. Iâ€™d wholeheartedly recommend the Taverna San Trovaso near the Accademia bridge, which although not cheap you donâ€™t mind parting with the cash as the ambience and food are superb. Lastly, your average Venetian is a really nice patient, tolerant and pleasant guy. Weâ€™ve been immensely impressed with the helpful way the public transport staff, museum people and locals put up with hordes of â€˜strangerosâ€™ like us invading their wonderful city and fumbling about with their magnificent language.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: trveler50
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the middle of the Venice tourist scene. It sits almost next to the Bridge of Sighs. The decor was beautiful. It was clean and the rooftop terrace was so quiet at night you could hardly believe you were in a big city. Stephano and the staff were great hosts. Trust his recommendations for restaurants but make sure you eat one meal at his own restaurant attached to the hotel. He does have the best seafood risotto in the city. Next time in Venice we will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: 11smiles
Reviews.Content: We only spent one night in this fabulous little hotel in the heart of Venice. We arrived after lunch and before dinner but they provided snacks and wine on their rooftop terrace. The breakfast was perfect; yogurt, fruit, pastries, great coffee and even eggs. Susanna was very helpful with the maps and where to go. We ate at the Taverna dei Dogi before we left and the food was very good. An all around great stay, just wish it could have been longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay during the Biennale!”
Reviews.Author: windsurfer_2003
Reviews.Content: The owners, Stefano and Susanna, and staff really took good care of us throughout our stay. As with other reviewers posting here, they arranged early breakfast for us on the day we were flying home. The photos here and on the website are accurate representatives of the clean and stylish rooms. We had a great view of the courtyard and the Doge's palace. Good breakfast. We njoyed the warm pastries with apple filling. Coffee was made to order. We were always full enough that we never tried the omelletes, though they were always offered. For those debating whether or not to buy that extra guidebook, they had a small library of guidebooks at the front desk. Also umbrellas--though it only rained a bit one afternoon out of 4 days. Early in our visit, we took the Secret Itineraries tour of the Doge's Palace and could see our room and balcony from the top floor near one of the cells in which Casanova had been imprisoned. It was sort of cool looking back at that window from our room. Overall, the location could not be better. We were in the center of everything, but it was very quiet. It was great to be able to come back to our Ca' dei Dogi oasis throughout the day for short rests. We will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: larklaw
Reviews.Content: Great staff---small hotel but excellent location---got off water taxi and was right around corner. Rooms are small but very nice--bathrooms were very nice. We had a nice patio overlooking a courtyard where we had our comp bottle of wine from the hotel. Breakfast was simple and good. Tucked away on tiny alley/street so was very quiet. When we stayed the price/value was excellent in comparison to other hotels nearby and with the newer interior finish of rooms much nicer than others we had looked at.

Reviews.Title: “Three reasons make the difference...”
Reviews.Author: margarida
Reviews.Content: The first reason that makes this Hotel a special one is its location! Right in the middle of all action in Venice but in absolutely quiet location. We stayed in Ca Dei Dogi on the last 4 days of the Carnival 2008 and had a fantastic time there! The other two reasons are Stephano and Susanna! They are the most kind and helpful people that we have found in any Hotel. They answered all our questions about restaurants, things to do, etc always with a smile and made everything to make our first time in Venice unforgettable! Our room was the one on the 4th floor, with a double bed and a single bed for my son in a little room attached. Beautiful decoration, comfortable bed and great modern bathroom! Free internet access at the reception In the first night we ate at the hotel restaurant â€œTaverna Dei Dogiâ€�,but the ambience and food are not at the same level than the hotel itself. The following days we ask Stephano for recommendations and found some nice little restaurants .Our favourite was â€œMarco Poloâ€�. About Venice Carnival, what can I say? Simply fantasticâ€¦look some of my pictures and go there at least one time in your lifeâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Good location, beautiful hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: StacyHR
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at this hotel in Venice and it was a great place. The service is excellent and SO friendly. We got there early - around 9AM from the overnight train from Germany and were able to drop off our luggage. They gave us croissants with marmalade and expresso and then we were off to explore Venice. When we went back after lunch, our luggage was in our room. The room was great - air conditioning, state of the art bathroom (the shower had like 10 jets!), tv with cable, all very beautifully decorated. Venice is a city that's hard on you (crowded, dense, etc) and it was so wonderful to be able to pop into the hotel to rest and freshen up between seeing St. Marks and the Dogi Palace - the location cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: HerefordUKHappyman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in early Dec 07 the service is first class, Stefano looked after us very well. The food is the best please try. The hotel is a little difficult to find first time down a little alley but there are little alleys everywhere we loved it .

Reviews.Title: “Amzing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gjck
Reviews.Content: Amazing Hotel Steps away from St. Mark's Square! The staff at this hotel were amazing, even upgraded our room for free as my husband was sick! They even came with us the the pharmacia to translate! The rooms were beautiful and clean. Loved the balcony you could see the palace, the bridge of sighs and hear the bells and the gondoliers singing! Amazing deal, well worth the price. Very good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: AZStaish
Reviews.Content: After having a heck of a time finding the hotel (the alleys in Venice are sooo confusing!) we settled in for a pleasant stay. My parents stayed in the actual hotel, my husband and I booked the "apartment" which was amazing.
