The hotel had up to date amenities and the apartment had the largest shower of all our hotels in Europe. A small breakfast was included- which was just enough to keep us going until lunchtime. The hotel location was great... right by the water bus stop and minutes from St Marks Square. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Discreet pied a terre”
Reviews.Author: mbdgblue
Reviews.Content: A September to remember - forever !! An awe-inspiring adventure in Venice for our 20th Anniversary began at this lovely establishment. The accommodations were superb, views from the terrace amazing and Stefano's expertise exceptional! I would recommend this jewel for anyone who wants to experience the true fantasy of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ca' dei Dogi”
Reviews.Author: CSNunes
Reviews.Content: It is a very little hotel but great! The hotels photos on the website do not lie, the rooms are really that nice. I was in a single room, it was very small but superb. It had everything in a small place, from safe, to TV, to phone, just everything! The bathroom was great, just out of a decoration magazine .. really perfect. I would like my home bathroom to be like that. You just felt good in that room. It was very very confortable. And for the quality of Venice hotels, this was great! It is worth you money. The hotel is small, like almost all hotels in Venice. It does not have a lift, so do not bring too many bags. It does not have internet acess. The location is perfect, just next to Piaza San Marco. And with direct link to the airport boats. The service was 5 stars, very friendly, very helpfull. The room was spotless, very very clean. There is also a restaurant, with great Italian food, very traditional.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: TheGuandos
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a two night stay at Ca' dei Dogi. Had such a great experience and would highly recommend this hotel. Room was small but very well appointed and decorated. Right in the heart of Venice, but very quiet. Staff were very friendly and helpful with directions/travel arrangements/restaurant recommendations etc. Perfect hotel for a weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Staff”
Reviews.Author: LuckySouth
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in November 2007. As it was our first time to Venice we were unfamiliar. We walked directly off the boat, straight ahead, and asked at the first hotel "Daniel" for directions. They called Stephano, and he met us within two minutes. It was a short, short walk down an alley and we were there. No dragging the luggage forever through streets. He carried my luggage upstairs (poor guy). We were so surprised to see our double room with balconey. It was modern, pristine, fresh smelling and clean. The bathroom was gorgeous. It felt luxurious and comforting. There was a safe, phone, a window, balconey and a stocked mini bar. We were in heaven. Stephano is so, so professional, helpful and kind. The breakfast was fine. We ordered 3 coffee's each (and no they did not look at us funny or feel put out), fresh fruit, rolls, toast, juice, yogurt and omlette. We were not hungry for hours. Our waiter was always kind, all smiles and asked if we wanted more coffee, and so forth. They made us feel welcome, like guests, and treated us with smiles and kindness around every corner. The location is next to none, I could see doges palace outside of my balconey, and it was minutes (less than 5 ) on foot. Stephano went out of his way making dinner reservations, mapping us out and teaching us about the Italian government. When you have a host like this, it truly makes the experience so much fuller and richer. I recommend this hotel to anyone, my room was one step up than the standard double, and well worth it. We were pleased that we found this hotel and met such a lovely person and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Ca Dei Dogi was the Best!”
Reviews.Author: arodg
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in October and absolutely loved the hotel. Stefano couldn't have been nicer or more helpful, he was quick to assist us with everything, answered all of my husband's questions about the many switches in our room, and even printed off the water bus times to make sure we got to our train on time. The room was quite lovely and everything seemed brand new. We thoroughly enjoyed the breakfast and there was more than enough food to eat - fruit, croissants, bread, yogurt, cappuccino and an omlette! And the location was fabulous! We stayed at six different hotels during our trip in Europe and Ca Dei Dogi was by far our favorite. We wish Venice was closer so we could stay at this great hotel more often!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: oj2020
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a lovely time in Venice - and staying here made it so much more enjoyable. It is a little tough to find - but so is pretty much everything else in Venice (aside from the major tourist attractions/museums, etc). The breakfast was typical - and satisfactory. We stayed in the top floor room with the amazing sitting room. I fell in love with the glass in the windows! The room was very clean, comfortable, and the staff and owners were so friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel near Piazza San Marco”
Reviews.Author: minkKC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Ca dei Dogi for 3 nights in early October in the single room, my sister and her husband had a double room. My single room was tiny as everyone has described, but had everything I needed and was simple and modern. Didn't miss the lack of space at all. Even though the room was small, the bathroom, although not huge, was bigger than I expected considering the room size. Shower was actually pretty big by Italy standards! We buzzed at the door when we arrived, and Stefano was there within a minute or so. There is no elevator, but he had someone bring the luggage up the stairs to our rooms. Other than that, there was generally someone (Stefano or Susanna) at the desk in the morning, but we were given a key to the outside door, as the rest of the day there usually wasn't anyone there, although they did tell us we could bug them at their restaurant next door if we needed anything. We didn't want to bother them, but keep this in mind if you are wanting any information - ask in the morning. Breakfast was bigger than a previous review stated. They might have arrived early? Started at 8am if I remember correctly, and the tables were already set with fruit salad and melba toasts upon arrival, but then when you sat down, they would bring out yogurt, cornetti, and offer you a capuccino and an omlette. Probably one of the best things about the hotel is the proximity to Piazza San Marco - right around the corner. Not only was it a great location (especially for a first visit to Venice), but it was easy to find too. Just follow all the signs to Piazza San Marco... Surprisingly, the hotel was really quiet. Couldn't hear any outside noise (or from other rooms either) at all. Other than that, the price was really reasonable for Venice. I believe I paid around 100 Euro per night for my single room, think my sister and brother-in-law paid about 150 per night for their double. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Small and Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: PLUSES++++ ROOMS: Even though the rooms were small, they were VERY nicely furnished and super clean. I loved the marble bathroom and balcony overlooking the courtyard and Doge's Palace. STAFF: The staff was very friendly LOCATION: The location could not have been better. It is a short walking distance from the Vaporetto Stop and 5 minutes from San Marco. MINUSES---- BREAKFAST: This was the only disappointing thing about the hotel. I only ate breakfast here once and all you get is a fruit cup and pre-packaged dry toast. Even though I would have liked more, at least I understand that having only a handful of rooms makes it hard to have a larger breakfast RESTAURANTS Food in Venice was a little disappointing. Its expensive and not as good as other Italian cities so I was kind of surprised to find that the hotel restaurant was actually pretty good and reasonably price. Plus you get a discount for staying at the hotel. OVERALL This hotel ranks as one of my favorite European hotels. I can not say enough good things about it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel in the perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: CorinneC
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a short trip to Venice - we stayed at Ca' dei Dogi for 2 nights. We had room 401, which is the one on the top floor, and has a small terrace and a little extra room attached to it. The bathroom had a power shower, and everything was nicely decorated and clean. Other users have commented on how small some rooms can be, but this room didn't feel too small. The stairs are a bit of a "killer" as the room was on the top floor, but we got used to them. The staff are very friendly - we got a few recommendations one night when we were looking for a nice place to eat, and the day we left, they kindly let us leave our luggage in the reception because our flight was late at night. Breakfast was nice - tea/coffee, fruit juice, selection of breads, omelette. The location is perfect - we walked everywhere most of the time. We only got a 12-hour vaporetto ticket on the second day, when we visited the Gran Canal, the cimetery, Murano, and other sights around Venice. We would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A small jewel in a jewel of a city”
Reviews.Author: laureldg
Reviews.Content: Ca' Dei Dogi is in a perfect location behind the Doge's Palace. You walk along the water past the Palace, go over a bridge, then turn into the first alley on your left, make the next left into another alley, and voila! you are in a small courtyard facing a beautiful old home that has been turned into an up to date small hotel of six rooms. Each room is different, but each is contemporary and warmly furnished with a modern bathroom. We had the room four flights up with a small terrace and a beautiful little alcove lined with circular panels of glass and automatic shades that went down at the touch of a button. The hotel does not have an elevator, but our luggage was brought up and down the stairs by the staff, so it wasn't a problem. The rate included a wonderful breakfast of juice, croissants, yogurt, fruit salad, and eggs made to order. The best part of the hotel was that is was absolutely quiet - a difficult task in a city as crowded as Venice. The location couldn't be beat as it was central to everything and very easy to return to at the end of a long day of walking and sightseeing. Stefano and Susanna at the front desk were amazing. There was no task too small for them to help us with. They were especially gracious when we wanted to email and fax a store in Greece to get bills for items we purchased. The service we got was better than we could have gotten at a 5 star hotel. We felt that this was a great value in a very expensive city. Yes, the beds were too hard for my taste and the pillows were a bit flat and hard (not the down I'm accustomed to). But this hotel excelled in every other way - immaculate, tastefully decorated, and a great value for the price. We recommend it highly for people looking for a small, quiet, intimate hotel in a great location with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely divine”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyandJohn
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4nights at the Ca' dei Dogi apartment which is immediately oppsite the main boutique hotel. Stefano and Suzanna are the most delightful, helpful hosts/owners. We arrived in the pouring rain and were immediately taken to our 6th floor apartment to enable us to dry out and relax. Stefano threw open the shutters to our terrace to reveal a view to the palace and campanile. The terrace is framed by pots and pots of miniature roses. Our apartment was spacious with fully equipped kitchen, living room, seperate bedroom and bathroom and was immaculately clean. The location - superb!!! The Bridge of Sighs is 10 metres away and St Marco square is a 2 minute walk - get up at dawn and stroll to the square to see it empty of crowds - breathtaking!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: EuroTraveler43
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Ca' dei Dogi on our recent trip to Italy. We were absolutely thrilled with our accomodations. We stayed in the only room on the 1st floor. It is a small dbl. with two beds. The room was small but looked to have been recently renovated. The bathroom was small but done in nice marble tile and had a large tub with shower attachments. We usually stay in hotels ranging from 125 - 185 euro and this was definately one of the nicer places we have stayed. It is small hotel and you see the owners daily. They will go out of their way to help you with restaurants, water taxis, trains, tours, etc. The location can't be beat. It is literally a 5 minute walk from St. Mark's square. It's also only a 5 minute walk from the S. Zaccaria vaparetto stop, so it is extremely convenient for arriving and departures on the water taxis. If you are staying in Venice and are looking in the price range I mentioned, I highly recommend you give Ca' dei Dogi a try. We will definately return the next time we are in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “A Home Away from home in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Fleurdelis
Reviews.Content: It is hard to say what is the best thing about Cai dei Dogi...that is because everything is wonderful. From the moment we arrived, Susanna and Stefano went out of their way to make us feel at home. They not only tell you what restaurant to go to to avoid the toursit rip off joints, but they will even share willingly their favorite menu items at each place. The location is unbeatable...smack dab next to St Marks Square and the Hotel Danieli..you'd think it would be too noisy in this area but once inside the walls of Ca Dei Dogti, it is peaceful and quiet.. It is also only 1 block from the major vaporetto stop of S. Zaccaria/San Marco. ..We were in Room 301 and altho small, it is very comfortable...all new and trendy and modern. A nice change form the dusty typical Venetian decor. We had a small private balcony that overlooks the Cardinals gardens!!! If your room does not have a balcony, there is one at the top for everyone to use! Breakfast is nice and they will even make you eggs if you want! We would definetely stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: debstah
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a perfect location about 2 minutes from Piazza San Marco off a little alley next to the Doge's Palace. The major San Zaccaria vaporetto stop, with lines that go anywhere you could possibly need, is right by the hotel. When I checked in and (I believe) Stefano handed me the keys, he said "we give you a key to the building because we are like family here" or something like that. And that is exactly how you feel at the wonderful Ca dei Dogi. The hotel may be in an old palace, but everything inside has been redone and is new and modern. Namely, the staircases are not nearly as steep or narrow as I was expecting (2 rooms are up one flight of stairs, another 2 rooms are up 2 flights of stairs, and then up from there). I had the single room, room 302, up two flights of stairs, for 4 nights from Aug 29 to Sept 2. As Stefano opened the door to my room, he said "it's small but has everything you need" Well he was right, it is VERY small, but it did have everything I needed and I was never once bothered by the size. If having big hotel rooms is important to you, this would not be the hotel to stay in (though I did peek into a couple of the double rooms and they were bigger, but still not huge). Very comfortable bed, excellent air conditioning, a small LCD TV with lots of stations (including CNN and BBC), a small but very clean modern bathroom with plenty of nice big fluffy towels, a decent-sized shower with 2 shower heads, and a bidet. Everything seemed relatively new in the entire hotel and everything was immaculately clean. There was also a nice little safe and fridge/minibar in the room and a little closet with plenty of hangers, and an extra pillow and blanket. The hotel also has a lovely little terrace on the top where you can have an evening drink and listen to the sounds from nearby San Marco. However, the hotel is impeccably quiet at night as it faces onto a little courtyard and the back of the Doge's Palace. Breakfast was OK, served from 8-10:15 in the morning. A very kind young man (who I presume is a waiter in the hotel's restaurant) was there every day, offering coffee (american style), espresso, and handmade cappuccinos, which I quite enjoyed. There were prepackaged hard little cracker/toast/biscuit things on the table and various flavors of yogurt, and he brought out fruit-filled croissants and some kind of delicious red orange drink. Some days I got offered an omelette, but not all. Perhaps the man who cooks it comes in later as 2 days I had breakfast around 8am and the other 2 days (when I was offered the omelette) after 9am. Anyway, it was adequate if not wonderful. The staff at the hotel is great. In addition to the man taking care of breakfast (whose name I unfortunately never caught), Susanna went above and beyond. The day before I was to leave, she asked me at breakfast if everything was OK for my departure the following day. I told her I had a train booked leaving from Mestre and she had me log into my email from the front desk so that she could try to change it - she said she would be too worried about me not making it to the right train in time and she wanted me to take a train leaving from the Venice S.L. station. Anyway, she was unable to change it but she printed out the schedules and my email with the train numbers for me, and I couldn't have thanked her enough. What service. Besides the average breakfast, I can only think of 2 other minor complaints. There's no internet access for guests, which would have been nice. But as I said, this is minor. The only other complaint is that one of the young men working in the restaurant essentially tried to ask me out multiple times to the point where it got obnoxious. When I arrived, Stefano had him bring my suitcase up the 2 flights of stairs and it was difficult to get him to leave my room. Two days later he stopped me on the staircase and it was difficult to get him to understand that my answer was no. And he was there all the time - early in the morning taking out trash and cleaning outside the hotel, later at night working at the restaurant, so avoiding him was difficult. I don't think he meant any harm but as this was one of my first experiences upon my arrival to Venice and the Ca dei Dogi, it was a bit frustrating. But it did not ruin my image of the hotel or the wonderful city of Venice, I just write this as a heads up to other females, especially those of us traveling alone. All in all, for the location, price, quality of accommodation and friendliness of the service, I doubt you can beat the Ca dei Dogi in Venice. I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else!

HotelInfo.Name: Ca' dei Dogi
HotelInfo.Address: Corte Santa Scolastica | Castello 4242, 30122 Venice, Italy
